tender_title: Invitation to Tender for the Collection and Disposal of Landfill Leachate at an Appropriate Treatment Works
tender_description:
Herefordshire Council requires the supply of tanker lorries with drivers, to collect landfill leachate and septic tank sewage from two closed landfill sites in Herefordshire; one in Stretton Sugwas and the other in Strangford, for disposal at an appropriate treatment works. 

The collection of leachate will be required throughout the week and the amount of leachate collected will vary throughout the year, with more collections required during the wetter months. The treatment works should dispose of the leachate under the relevant industry standards.
classification_description: Sewage, refuse, cleaning and environmental services

tender_title: SC21056 - Removal of Fly-tipped Waste (Barnfield Park)

This Contract Further Competition Procedure (FCP) under Lot 2 (Collection and Disposal of Specialist Waste Streams) of the ESPO framework for Hazardous and Specialist Waste Services (Ref. Framework 378/20).

tender_title: 10142 - Installation of thermodynamic hot water and photovoltaic (PV) systems to social housing properties
tender_description:
NPS Norwich Ltd (NPSN), on behalf of Norwich City Council (the council), manages the maintenance and repair of the social housing property portfolio that comprises of approx. 14,600 homes . In order to maintain the property stock in good condition it is necessary to undertake repairs and maintenance as appropriate.  The council also seeks to invest in eco retrofit solutions where appropriate.
The council is looking for a single contractor to complete the installation of as many thermodynamic hot water and photovoltaic (PV) systems to its social housing within the value of the contact.
Homes must be left with fully operational systems. 
The value of the contract works shall be to the maximum value of £425,000.  
Properties may receive one or both technologies.
For the purposes of this tender, we are working on the basis the value of works will be split approximately 50% for PV Solar systems and 50% for thermodynamic systems.  
This work will be carried out in an effort to reduce fuel poverty, assist in the reduction of the cities carbon footprint and increase individual properties standard assessment procedure (SAP) scores. 
Norwich has a very varied demographic.  It is home to the Aviva Head Office, Norwich Research Park and the University of East Anglia; but there are pockets of deprivation across the city where four in every ten children live in poverty, a low educational attainment record, high unemployment and 25% of housing is council rented (taken from the 2011 Census).  The contractor must understand the complexities that working with such a diverse community may bring.
There might be some properties with vulnerable occupants.  These properties may require particular attention in that they will require work or resource over and above the standard specification.

tender_title: ITT for Collection, Transportation, Handling and Disposal/Treatment of Highways Related Waste - AWARD
tender_description:
ITT for Collection, Transportation, Handling and Disposal/Treatment of Highways Related Waste
      
      Sandwell Metropolitan Borough Council (\"the Council\") has implemented a Waste Improvement Plan to develop its waste, cleansing services and infrastructure. This included entering into a strategic partnership contract with Serco, in relation to integrated waste and cleansing services, bringing private sector capacity, expertise and investment to this service area. 
      
      As a strategic partner Serco now delivers a number of services on behalf of the Council, however this does not include the collection, handling, transportation, storage, recovery or disposal of Highways Related Waste.  This tendering exercise is seeking expressions of interest from experienced and qualified contractors to deliver these requirements. 
      
      As set out in the Environmental Protection Act (1990), section 34 of the Act imposes a duty of care on persons concerned with \"controlled waste\". 
      
      Under this Act, the Council has identified itself as the producer of \"controlled waste\", in relation to this Contract and has a responsibility and a legal obligation to comply with the duty of care to ensure that this controlled waste is managed properly and recovered or disposed of safely.
      
      The Council is seeking to appoint one Contractor to deliver a seamless service under a Framework Agreement (\"Contract\"), who has the necessary economic and financial standing and who can clearly demonstrate it has experience of delivering similar services.
      
      The Council will not be breaking the requirement down into individual lots. The Contractor will undertake to deliver the whole service requirement from providing advice in relation to storage and classification of the waste prior to its actual collection, collection of the waste, sorting of the waste and then delivering the waste to appropriate destinations (recovery operations and or landfill) for final recovery or disposal. 
      
      The Contractor will not be required to operate their own landfill sites, or waste operations for recovery or metal recycling, but will hold responsibility for ensuring that the most effective method of disposal which will result in least damage to the environment is selected for disposal, together with ensuring that the selected recovery operations or disposal sites have the appropriate licences, permits or exemptions.

tender_title: Treatment of Street Sweeping Waste
tender_description:
In pursuance of the Council's obligations as a waste collection and disposal authority the Council intends through a competitive tender to award a contract for the Treatment of Street Sweeping Waste.  
Bidders will be required to provide a Treatment Site for this waste for the duration of the Services which will divert a minimum of 80% of the waste received from landfill.  The Council may award more than one Contract if it demonstrates value for money to do so and consideration will be given to the proximity principle and the environmental impact of tenders when awarding the Contract(s). The Contract will commence on 7 May 2018 (\"the Commencement Date\") and continue for a Term of 2 years, with a right for the Council to extend the Term on one or more occasions up to 6 May 2022.
classification_description: Sewage, refuse, cleaning and environmental services
buyer_name: Bath and North East Somerset Council

tender_title: Maintenance, Servicing and Inspection of Landfill Site Gas and Leachate Infrastructure
tender_description:
The City of Bradford Metropolitan District Council (the Council) is seeking to source a suitably licensed Contractor to deliver the Service which is composed of the Maintenance and monitoring of Landfill Sites, Gas Pipework and Leachate Infrastructure.
The objective of the contract is to ensure the Council meets and fulfils its legal, statutory and permitted obligations and duties in regards to Maintenance and monitoring of Landfill Sites and associated infrastructure.
The contract is required to start approximately 7th April 2020 and will run for a fixed period of two years until 31st March 2022 with the option to extend for an additional two year period. The Contractor will carry out the service on behalf of the Council for a fixed hourly labour rate as detailed in the pricing matrix.

tender_title: Transfer Station Baler
tender_description:
SWISCo, a company wholly owned by and delivering services on behalf of Torbay Council, has a requirement for a replacement baler at its waste transfer station at Tor Park Rd, Paignton TQ4 7PL. The Contract will be between SWISCo and the successful Supplier.

This Contract will be for:

•	removal and disposal of the existing baler
•	any site modifications required, including to the current conveyor feed so that it is compatible with the new baler, and safety barriers
•	supply, delivery, installation and commissioning of the replacement baler
•	training of 8 staff
•	5-year maintenance agreement (optional)

tender_title: BSH/ENR/Welsman Building Decarbonisation Project
tender_description:
Further competition under lot 4 of the Non-Domestic Energy Efficiency Framework DN457472.\r
\r
Bristol City Council wishes to procure a contractor to carry out a number of decarbonisation measures to the Welsman Building.\r
The site has been awarded funding to decarbonise the heating system and reduce electricity consumption through the design, supply and installation of a number of measures. The measures have been developed by BCC consultant Anthesis, who have produced indicative designs for many of the elements of work. The Contractor will assume full design responsibility for the Works. The drawings and schedules provided as part of the works information are there to assist the contractor understand better the nature and scope of the works, but it is for the Contractor to ascertain the precise nature and extent of works required, and produce their own design. The Contractor's detailed design will be submitted for review and acceptance before works proceed

o	A14 Fenstanton (junction 27) to Stow-cum-Quy both sides  =  4km (reduced due to new road construction works)

o	A11 6 mile Bottom to Stumps Cross both sides  =  34.5 km

•	The contract is for 3 year term with the option to extend each and every year for a further 2 years.

tender_title: Provision of Confidential Waste Destruction Services for Swindon Borough Council
tender_description: Swindon Borough Council invites expressions of interest from suitably qualified and experienced service providers for the provision of confidential waste paper destruction and recycling services. The initial contract term will be for 24 months with an option to extend for a further 24 months (1 period of 24 months) for a potential total contract term of 4 years as stated in the RFQ documents. This procurement is for the provision of confidential waste paper destruction and recycling services to a wide range of properties within the Council's portfolio. Due to the nature of the Council's portfolio and financial challenges, over the course of this contract there are likely to be additions, reductions and removals from this list. Full details relating to the Services are provided in the RFQ documents. To participate, Suppliers will need to Register as a Supplier with ProContract, www.supplyingthesouthwest.org.uk, then Register an Interest before obtaining access to the tender documents. In the event of difficulties registering as a supplier, please refer to the System Administrator Proactis support team ProContractSuppliers@proactis.com RFQ clarifications to be submitted in writing via Messaging in ProContract tender portal, including the project reference and title clearly in the Subject title, by 28th April 2020, 1400 hrs UK Local time. The Council's responses to these clarification questions will be issued periodically via Messaging in ProContract tender portal. RFQ Responses are required to be submitted no later than 1st May 2020, 1400 hrs UK Local time via ProContract tender portal - https://www.supplyingthesouthwest.org.uk/ Please note that this project has been advertised on Contracts Finder/ other web portals, however, Supplying the South West Portal, https://www.supplyingthesouthwest.org.uk/ is the only portal that includes all the relevant documents required to respond to this opportunity, bearing Project Id: DN472640 No Tender submissions will be considered without completing the RFQ documents in full including attachments and returning them in alignment with the instructions within the RFQ documents.

The service provider will have the ability to provide a suitable, sufficient, prompt and reliable collection of tankered waste service from various sites, and will have suitable processing facilities or details of secondary processing plants in order to undertake the service.\r

tender_title: Transportation of Waste Materials
tender_description:
The Borough Council of Newcastle-under-Lyme is looking to procure a Service Provider for the provision of containers and transportation of waste materials to various locations.
The Service Provider is to supply containers and transportation.
The contract shall be effective from no later than 18th June 2018 to 18th June 2020 with a possible extension of two, One year periods, upon satisfactory service delivery as deemed by the Council.
The Service Provider must be appropriately licenced and able to accept the waste effective from the start date of the contract.
The Borough Council of Newcastle under Lyme shall deliver all waste to Knutton Lane Depot, Knutton Lane, Newcastle-under-Lyme, ST5 2SL for the contractor to provide suitable and sufficient on site storage and licensed onward transportation to treatment facility(s).
The treatment operations shall comply with the guidelines and regulations published by DEFRA and the Government. This includes an appropriate waste management license issued by the Environment Agency, and other related permissions associated with processing operations.

tender_title: Business Support for Renewable Energy Generation in Small and Medium Enterprises (SMEs) - AWARD
tender_description:
Provider of Business Support is a fundamental part of the delivery of the European Regional Development Funded Low Carbon Opportunities Programme, which is scheduled to run from October 2019 to September 2022
      
      The programme will enable and encourage small and medium sized enterprises (SMEs) to adopt renewable energy technologies with the provision of free to the business support (Assists) to help SMEs identify and analyse possible renewable energy options.
      
      The programme will support SMEs to adopt low carbon energy installations, such as Solar PV, Biomass, ASHP, GSHP, CHP, Geothermal, Hydro and Solar Thermal. 
      
      The programme will also increase the number of SMEs in Worcestershire generating renewable energy, (an increase of at least 942kWp). It will reduce carbon emissions by at least 652 tonnes CO2e and increase job creation and protection.
      
      The programme will meet these aims through the provision of independent, free consultancy support, grant funding, networking opportunities and events.
classification_description: Petroleum products, fuel, electricity and other sources of energy

Quotations are being sought for the provision of an inspector to undertake food safety inspections of category C and D rated premises which are currently 4 and 5 in terms of the Food Hygiene Rating Scheme (FHRS). The contract is for 250 inspections, with the possibility of additional inspections being required on completion of the 250. It is intended that premises will be allocated in batches of approximately 50-60 every 3 months. Inspections, must when practicable, be completed within 3 month period.

Full details can be found within the invitation to tender.

tender_title: Victoria Park Lodge Café - AWARD
tender_description:
Portsmouth City Council, 'the Authority', is inviting tenders from suitably qualified and experienced operators to deliver a café service with accompanying social value outcomes in Victoria Park. 
      
      The Authority is also seeking to maximise social value and benefits from a range of additional service/s that could be offered, for example gardening, animal welfare, and events in the park.
      
      This tender offers an exciting opportunity to work in partnership with the Authority to deliver a range or social value outcomes and to improve the park for the benefit of both residents and visitors.
      
      The lodge will provide an excellent facility to improve the offer of Victoria Park by providing a base for a high quality café, while simultaneously contributing to the Authority's aspiration of encouraging and enabling vulnerable residents.
      
      The successful operator will be appointed via a service concession contract with associated lease agreement. The Authority is targeting to have awarded the service concession by 9th June 2017. The café should ideally be opened before the end of Summer 2017 in order to take advantage of summer trading.

tender_title: Sewerage Effluent and Liquid Waste Collection and Disposal Service
tender_description:
Fenland District Council wish to appoint a suitable contractor to undertake our Sewerage Effluent and Liquid Waste Collection and Disposal Service.  Three year contract with possible two year extension.

Fenland District Council owes, operates and maintains a number of Sewerage Treatment Works (STW), including Foul and Surface Water Pumping Stations (PS), Cess Pits (CP) and Oil/Petrol Interceptors (PI).   The sites are all situated within the District of Fenland, in North Cambridgeshire and currently number 21 sites.

Contractor should meet the legal and environmental obligations for the safe removal and disposal of Effluents and Liquids.

To express your interest and request tender documents please email:  procurement@fenland.gov.uk by Friday 7th June 4pm

tender_title: Energy Efficiency and Renewable Energy Assessments in Public Sector Buildings in Worcestershire - AWARD
tender_description:
Energy efficiency and renewable energy "Assists" are a fundamental part of the delivery of the European Regional Development Funded, Public-Sector Energy Efficiency Programme (PEEP/the Programme), which is scheduled to run from October 2019 until September 2022. 
      
      PEEP will provide free to the beneficiary "Assists" for public-sector organisations in Worcestershire by experts who will advise on the potential for energy efficiency improvements and/or renewable energy opportunities of at least 70 public sector properties.
      
      PEEP will provide grants between £2k and £200k for improvements, where a specific need has been identified, (at least 60% match funded by the beneficiary) to help public-sector organisations invest in energy efficiency and/or renewable energy measures.  A capital grant fund of £1m will be available.
      
      PEEP is managed by Worcestershire County Council (WCC), who will run a series of events for Worcestershire public-sector organisations, highlighting the benefits of energy efficiency & renewable energy and promoting innovative energy solutions.  
      
      PEEP will run alongside the successful Business Energy Efficiency (BEEP) and Low Carbon Opportunities (LoCOP) programmes; which have been active since 2016 and have, to date, provided over 500 energy efficiency and renewable energy assessments to local businesses and >£2m grants for carbon-saving improvements. 
      
      If you wish to view the documents for this opportunity please click `Express Interest`. 
      
      Following this, if you wish to apply for this opportunity please click `Opt in` which will then enable you to view and complete the Standard Questionnaire and upload the relevant documents.
      
      After uploading all required documents and completing the questionnaire(s) please remember to press the `Submit your Return` button at the bottom of the page.  
      
      Suppliers will receive a system generated email to confirm successful submission of their return.
      
      Any questions or clarification should be conducted via `Correspondence` through this portal.
classification_description: Petroleum products, fuel, electricity and other sources of energy

tender_title: Provision of WAMITAB Training for Waste Operatives
tender_description:
The City of Bradford Metropolitan District Council (the "Council") is is one of the largest Metropolitan Councils in the country and covers a wide geographic area including the towns of Bingley, Ilkley, Keighley and Shipley. The Council is responsible  for a number of services which benefit people living in the Bradford district. These services include social care, education, housing, highways, planning, environmental protection, libraries, street cleaning, waste collections and swimming pools. Further details of the Council's Priorities and Plans are available on the Council's internet site, Bradford Metropolitan District Council | Consultations | Our priorities

Bradford Council has two Waste Transfer stations (one in Bradford and one in Keighley), and 8 household waste recycling centres (four in Bradford and four in Keighley) which employ approximately 70 people.  Some of these are people who have worked in this area for a number of years and who have attained the required professional qualifications but will require the regular refresher training and a few are new starters who need to start working towards attaining the professional standard qualifications.  Whilst staff turnover is low it is anticipated that there will be some new staff during the period of this contract.

The Contract is expected to be for 24 months with 3 possible extensions each of 12 months. Contract extension will be at the discretion of the Council.

tender_title: Sale, Collection and Processing of Baled Steel Cans
tender_description:
The City of Bradford Metropolitan District Council (the Council) is seeking to source a suitably licensed Contractor to directly deliver the Service which is composed of the purchase (by the Contractor from the Council), collection, keeping, and recycling of Baled Steel Cans from the Council's Collection Point. The contract is required to start 15th September 2020 and will run for a fixed period of two years until 31st August 2022 with the option to extend for an additional one year period. The Contractor will purchase the Baled Steel Cans from the Council for a fixed rate per tonne which will track the published market rate each month.

The Contractor will be responsible for the collection, keeping and recycling of approximately 65 tonnes per month (780 per annum) of Baled Steel Cans in line with current methods and regulations. The bales weigh approx. 660kgs each and we anticipate 40 x bales to one curtain-sided load.

tender_title: Street Cleansing 2021
tender_description:
The operation is to include full width deep cleanse of identified paved & pedestrian areas, due to the sensitive nature of the infrastructure the preferred method is one using high heat low pressure to include the removal from all paved areas specified within the attached appendix all staining and chewing gum deposits. All completed areas must be cleansed to a standard that does not leave any unsightly striping or stippling effects that can occur if cleansing is uneven. 
Maps of each area are attached on The Chest. You are advised to visit each of the areas prior to submitting your tender proposal in order to gain a better understanding of each area to be cleaned.
Indicative Working times; 
The Deep Cleansing and Gum Removal cycle will be up to three times a year subject to weather conditions being suitable in agreement with the supervising officer. 
Commencing the end of February into March . 
Commencing the end of June into July.
Commencing the end of September into October.
Bidder to note that some areas require all 3 cleans, some are 2 cleans and some are a once only clean.
Please download the documents from, www.the-chest.org.uk

tender_title: 9643 - Green Waste Disposal Services
tender_description:
The requirement  is for up to 2 suppliers to provide a household green garden waste treatment and disposal service. These requirements are to be split into 2 Lots with one or two suppliers providing the service.

Lot 1 - Broadland District Council

Broadland District Council operates a paid-for, opt-in garden waste service. The service operates on a fortnightly basis, year-round but with no collections over the Christmas and New Year period - so 25 collections per year. Collections are made by another supplier and the current collected tonnage is circa 10,500 per annum.

Lot 2 - Norwich City Council

Norwich City Council operates a paid-for, opt-in garden waste service. The service operates on a fortnightly basis, year-round but with no collections over the Christmas and New Year period - so 25 collections per year. Collections are made by another supplier and the current collected tonnage is circa 3,800 per annum.

tender_title: CBC-0432-T-TS Household Waste and Recycling Centre  - AWARD
tender_description:
The Council is seeking a contract to manage specified waste infrastructure in the Authority area. The Contract  is for Lot 1, details of the lot is as follows:

Lot 1: Household Waste Recycling Centre Management Contract
The Council is seeking a Contractor to manage and operate its four Household Waste Recycling Centres (HWRCs). This will include the provision of management, day to day operation including recycling and recovery services, routine maintenance and transportation of all Contract waste from the sites to a nominated and/or agreed final disposal facilities, Waste Transfer Stations or re processing facilities. Bidders should note the Authority will be seeking to redeveloped its network of HWRCs during the early part of the contract term, this is a separate procurement and will not form part of this contract.
The anticipated contract start date is the 1st April 2015. The Contract term is 7.5 years with another 7.5 years possible extension period. 

The total tonnage collected at the Authoritys four HWRCs in 2013/14 was 28, 038 tonnes.

tender_title: FEW1050 - UoL Research Agreement Air Quality Grant 2020
tender_description:
LEICESTER City Council has been awarded £249,600 of air quality grant to help make further improvements to local air quality.\r
\r
The Defra air quality grant will be used to establish a pilot project over an 18-month period which will focus on behaviour change in a specific area of the city.\r
\r
In a continuation of previous joint working with the University of Leicester on Exposure to Air Quality Dependent on Transport Mode, UoL have outlined how they can achieve our goal of reducing air pollution in the defined location of the project by completing two areas of work:\r
\r
1.	Investigation into wood burning sources of PM2.5\r
•	Biomass burning is a source of atmospheric PM2.5. Levoglucosan generated through biomass burning can be used to calculate wood burning fraction of PM2.5.\r
•	Using filters placed in two or more locations, the contribution of wood burning to atmospheric aerosol can be identified.\r
\r
2.	Conducting detailed analysis of AQ monitor and map data and supporting traffic and wood burning fraction data, developing data-based public engagement strategies\r
\r
Due to previous joint working, where this project builds on work completed together from 2019/20 - 2020/21, together with time constraints between being awarded the funding and starting the project, the best course of action would be to secure services of UoL and to apply for the waiver. Without this the project will not be able to be successfully delivered which in turn is likely to negatively impact outcomes of our future bids for Defra grants.
classification_description: Sewage, refuse, cleaning and environmental services

tender_title: Comingled Recycling Treatment - AWARD
tender_description:
The fundamental purpose of this Contract is to provide to the participating Authorities (Bedford Borough Council and Central Bedfordshire Council), a service whereby the Contract Materials are collected in bulk and delivered to a Contract Facility (MRF) for sorting and onward sale.
      The Contractor either acting directly or using the services and facilities of one or more third parties approved by the Authority shall collect, receive, sort and segregate Contract Material at the Contract Facility(s) as necessary into separate recyclable streams and will be responsible for the onward marketing and sale of Recyclate.
      The Contractor shall provide or be responsible for the provision of adequate facilities for the storing of Contract Material before and after processing into separate recycling streams and have contingency measures in place for storage/ processing elsewhere should any incident occur preventing processing or haulage to end markets.

tender_title: Comingled Recycling Treatment - AWARD
tender_description:
The fundamental purpose of this Contract is to provide to the participating Authorities (Bedford Borough Council and Central Bedfordshire Council), a service whereby the Contract Materials are collected in bulk and delivered to a Contract Facility (MRF) for sorting and onward sale.
      The Contractor either acting directly or using the services and facilities of one or more third parties approved by the Authority shall collect, receive, sort and segregate Contract Material at the Contract Facility(s) as necessary into separate recyclable streams and will be responsible for the onward marketing and sale of Recyclate.
      The Contractor shall provide or be responsible for the provision of adequate facilities for the storing of Contract Material before and after processing into separate recycling streams and have contingency measures in place for storage/ processing elsewhere should any incident occur preventing processing or haulage to end markets.

tender_title: Request for Proposals for White Label Energy Agreement
tender_description:
Derby City Council (DCC) has taken the decision to offer a trusted local authority energy brand to its citizens as an alternative. DCC is seeking bids from OFGEM licensed energy providers that can deliver a white label gas and electricity product.

In December 2016 DCC and Derbyshire County Council conducted soft market testing to assess the viability of forming a white label arrangement with licensed energy providers. The soft market testing has helped us as an organisation clarify what is possible and how it aligns to our corporate goals. We have also taken the view that we will work independently, and not in conjunction with the County Council; however, we will explore possibilities for marketing in non-City areas in the future.

As part of this exercise, we are inviting companies to state how they will meet our vision and then propose draft terms and conditions for a white label arrangement.

This will take place using the East Mids Tenders e-tendering portal and you will need to register your company details at https://www.eastmidstenders.org.  Registration is a quick and easy process done by going to the website and clicking on the 'REGISTER' link at the top of the page. Further details of the exercise, including how to respond, are available on the portal (Project ID: DN234632).

Please note: organisations wishing to take part must express an interest by 12:00 on Thursday 2nd February. It is recommended you express and interest and obtain the documentation well before this time to allow sufficient time to prepare and submit your response. The deadline for responses is 14:00 on Friday 3rd February 2017.
classification_description: Petroleum products, fuel, electricity and other sources of energy

tender_title: Grounds Maintenance, Litter Collection, Bus Shelter Cleaning
tender_description:
Grounds Maintenance, Litter Collection & Bus Shelter Cleaning Contract(s) - Whitehill Town Council, Hampshire.  

The following provides an overview .  The ITT and supporting documents explain in detail the requirements of Whitehill Town Council and the procurement process for submitting a tender proposal.  To request the ITT and supporting documents please e-mail: Liz.manship@whitehilltowncouncil.gov.uk                                    


All tenders MUST be submitted on Whitehill Town Council paperwork.                               

Overview of Services Required:  

The Grounds Maintenance Service required broadly comprises grass cutting & strimming, clearance of hedge and fence lines, litter collection prior to these tasks and general clearance at various sites. 

The Litter Collection Service required broadly comprises litter picks at 7 of the Council's sites, including an inclosure, the emptying of rubbish and dog bins, the disposal of associated waste and, as required, the removal of gum & graffiti from Council owned assets. 

The Bus Cleaning Service required broadly comprises cleaning 23 Council owned bus shelters, and the removal of gum and graffiti as required. 

The land & property, as applicable to these services, is situated across the Parish of Whitehill, which includes Whitehill and Bordon.  

Fifteen sites comprise:  Grassed play areas with play equipment and exercise equipment;  Grassed open spaces for informal recreation; 	Recreation land with sports pitches;  Allotment pathway & verges; 	Skatepark; BMX tracks; Associated car parks; 23 Bus Shelters.
 
Whitehill Town Council invites contractors, companies and sole traders to tender for a three-year contract to include one, two or three of these services.
classification_description: Sewage, refuse, cleaning and environmental services

tender_title: SC19066 - HWRC Textiles and Shoes Collection and Processing Service
tender_description:
Kent County Council's Waste Management team is looking to procure a Concessions contract for the collection and processing of waste Textiles and Shoes from every Household Waste Recycling Centre (HWRC) across Kent, amounting to approximately 1956 tonnes per annum.

A new contract is required to be in place for commencement on 1 November 2020 for all 18 HWRCs to ensure service continuity, whereby KCC take title of all material to meet the statutory obligations of the Waste Disposal Authority. The initial contract term shall be 2 years, with an option to extend for a further 2 periods of up to 12 months each.

The Services provided under this Concessions contract involve the collection, sorting, storage, transporting, processing, recycling reuse, recovery and resale of all Textiles obtained from all 18 of KCC's HWRCs. The textiles collected from the HWRC sites should be either recycled or reused in accordance with KCC's expectations, planning, and permitting, whilst guaranteeing the best income possible for the taxpayer.  

Further information regarding this opportunity is contained within the Invitation to Tender documents.  Please follow this link to register your interest in this opportunity and gain automatic access to the Invitation to Tender online: https://procontract.due-north.com/Advert?advertId=5ce922c0-b7ee-ea11-8104-005056b64545&p=8691483f-2f3d-e711-80e1-005056b64545

tender_title: The replacement of internal heating systems at the Devonshire Street area of Norwich
tender_description:
The council owns and manages a district heating scheme serving council properties at Devonshire Street, Clifton Street, Derby Street, Cardigan Place, Goldsmith Street, Langley Walk, Midland Walk, Napier Place, Old Palace Road and Russell Street in Norwich. 

The procurement was necessary to upgrade the internal heating systems serving the 248 council operated dwellings due to age, 
obsolescence and condition. The works will extend the life expectancy of the internal district heating system ensuring a reliable and serviceable system for the next 20 years.   

The contract was procured via Eastern Procurement Ltd (EPL) who are a not-for-profit organisation offering specialist compliant framework agreements, social landlords and other public sector bodies, predominantly in the Eastern region. The council are owner members of EPL and work closely with them to create bespoke procurement frameworks. The frameworks promote value for money for the council and also include SMEs and local suppliers .A mini-competition exercise through the heating servicing, repairs, maintenance and installation works framework provided by EPL was explored with the seven framework suppliers.
classification_description: Electricity, heating, solar and nuclear energy

tender_title: BSH/ENR/Construction of Buried Heat Network Infrastructure (BEDD and others)
tender_description:
The council wishes to appoint a provider for installing a buried District Heating Network ("DHN") in the Bedminster area of Bristol. The contract will be for the build of approximately 1600 - 2000 linear meters of DHN in the Bedminster Area of Bristol.  The council will instruct works under an NEC4 Option C contract. The council is using X22 "Early Contractor Involvement X Option, which allows for a 2-stage process. 
Stage 1 - Contractor reviews the latest Client's Design with target depths and GPR overlay to update programme/budgets in accordance with the rates provided in the tender return. Contractor also issues a quality plan for review/acceptance. 
Stage 2 - Following review and subject to acceptance of the Contractor's Stage 1 submissions by the client, a notice to proceed is issued by the Project Manager for the Contractor to construct and commission works. 
The Scope sets out greater detail and outputs associated within these stages.

tender_title: Design Consultant for Hebburn Minewater Energy Scheme
tender_description:
South Tyneside Council have appointed a mechanical, electrical and civil design consultant to develop a detailed design of a £7m district energy infrastructure at Hebburn Town centre using innovative low carbon heat sources including mine water source heat pump and combined heat and power plant.

The work comprises of the design, layout, specification and detailing of process lines, operating equipment and building services of a district energy infrastructure including the development an energy centre and connections to existing buildings in Hebburn Town centre for both heat and power supply.

The contract shall be split in two phases, one to RIBA stage 3 for concept and validation of initial calculations including topographical, GPR and any other surveys required and permissions (planning advice initially), with the second a detailed design phase including planning, additional surveys and construction tender documents.

Construction phase support is also required.
Part 1 - May - October 2020
Part 2 (Dependant on scheme viability) - November 2020 until entire project completion, estimated to be December 2022.

tender_title: Whole House Retrofit, Worcester City
tender_description:
Worcester City Council has secured funding under the Local Authority Delivery Scheme Phase 2 (LAD2) to deliver energy efficiency upgrades to the worst performing EPC rated (EPC rating D, E, F or G) domestic properties in the City.  It is expected this project will result in improvements to a minimum of 80 private households.   Worcester City Council has also secured funding under the Local Authority Delivery Phase 1B to deliver external wall insulation works and solar PV. 

The appointed Contractor will carry out this programme of whole-house retrofits.  This is to include performing all retrofit roles required under PAS2035:2019. 

The LAD2 scheme will prioritise the installation of Solar PV, energy efficient doors and windows, high heat retention storage heaters and a range of low cost measures such as loft and cavity wall insulation, LED lighting, heating controls and hot water tank insulation. In addition, through the LAD 1B scheme, the Contractor may be asked to provide external wall insulation (EWI).

tender_title: CBC-1130-FW-TS Roecroft Lower School Catering Provision - AWARD
tender_description:
Catering Services provision for Roecroft Lower School in Stotfold, Hertfordshire, maintained by Central Bedfordshire. 
      
      ESPO Framework - 704_18 issue 5 - Catering Services - Lot 1 
      
      We are looking to appoint an experienced catering company to provide a high quality and affordable, value for money catering service at lunchtimes, using quality raw ingredients in dishes that are expertly cooked and beautifully presented with a smile.  
      
      Please note timeline with regards to questions and submission dates.
      
      All communication/correspondence and clarifications must be sent via the In-tend portal. Please do not contact the School directly.
      
      Please view the 'Clarification' tab for any updates or responses to questions asked.
      
      Please avoid uploading your return just prior to closing deadline as you may incure IT issues and we will not accept Tender Returns via e-mail.
      
      We will provide as much support and information as we can to help guide you through the Tender process.  Questions asked together with the response, will be made available to all suppliers tendering, to ensure a fair and consistent approach to all. If there is anything you are not sure of or need clarification of, then please contact us using the correspondence facility within the In-tend electronic tendering system.
      
      Please ensure that you inform us of your decision to participate. To submit a response, you will be required to Opt In.
      
      Opt In- This will confirm to us of your involvement and your intention to submit a return.
      
      Opt Out- This will confirm to us that you are not submitting a return. You will be able to provide a reason as to your decision and have the option to cease any system-generated communication. You will be able to opt back in at any point. 
      
      Target Contract Commencement: Transitional period to start on 11th November 2020 6 week period. TUPE applies. Handover 4th January 2021 
      
      Contract term: 2 years (+1+1+1 optional)

The services include the provision management, operation and maintenance of a transfer station. A key driver for this contract is to continue to maximise diversion of the contracting authority's residual waste from landfill, to retain or enhance recycling targets and to secure value for money. tender_title: Environmental Enforcement Services for Torbay Council
tender_description:
In order to reduce environmental crime and anti-social behaviour, Torbay Council is seeking an appropriately qualified / accredited organisation to issue Fixed Penalty Notices on its behalf, to offenders who are seen breaking the Environmental Protection Act 1990, the Clean Neighbourhoods and Environment Act 2005 and Anti-social Behaviour Crime and Policing Act 2014, in the streets, parks, beaches and open spaces within Torbay. This work will complement existing enforcement activity, at no cost to the Authority.

As such, Torbay Council is seeking to award a contract to a suitably experienced and qualified organisation that can provide uniformed enforcement officers and the necessary infrastructure, for the delivery of dedicated enforcement of each of the street scene issues (as outlined within the Tender), within the Torbay area.

Please refer to the Tender documents for full details of the requirements.
classification_description: Sewage, refuse, cleaning and environmental services

tender_description: The Council's refuse and recycling team are responsible for the domestic refuse and recycling collection services, this includes a service for the collection of unwanted household furniture such as sofas, chairs, cupboards, tables, beds, televisions and fridge freezers. This service is optional and offers an alternative to the Household Waste Recycling Centre, take back schemes when purchasing replacement goods and private collection companies. The service enables the opportunity for the local authority to minimise the amount of household furniture that is sent for landfill by providing the opportunity for reuse in the community or for the items to be recycled which helps Fylde Council achieve its recycling performance targets as well as national recycling targets.

tender_title: BULK HAULAGE OF WASTE
tender_description:
Lincolnshire County Council is seeking to procure a Service contract for the Bulk Haulage of Waste via an OJEU
Open Procedure in accordance with the Public Contract Regulations 2015. This Service contract shall be for a
five year duration with an option for a further 2 years extension. The value of the contract is anticipated to be
around £9.1 million pounds over 7 years.
Indicative total figures from April 2016 to March 2017 were that 131,838 tonnes of MSW was transported
from Waste Transfer Stations to either the EfW Facility or Final Disposal Points (See Schedule 1 Clients
Requirements and Schedule 8 Prescribed Routes from Section 12 Terms and Conditions within the ITT).The
Catalogued European Waste Catalogue number for this is defined as 20 03 01.
Full details of the Procurement, Clients requirements, Payment Mechanism and Performance Management
Framework are available within the Procurement Documents.
Bidders should note that they are Invited to a \"Bidders day\". It is proposed that the day will consist of time spent
at the Energy from Waste facility to show bidders the relevant areas and then to visit one of the Authorities
Waste Transfer Stations. It is highly advisable that bidders should visit this day. Wednesday 6th September
2017 is the provisional date for this. Further details about registering Interest for this can be viewed in the
Procurement Documents.

tender_title: Bulky Household Waste Collection Services
tender_description: South Lakeland District Council (the Council) invited tenders for the provision of Bulky Household Waste Collection Services throughout the district. The services provides for the collection of larger items that are not collected as part of the regular household waste kerbside collection service. Wherever possible items should be re-used or recycled in order to assist the Council in meeting its target of 65%, with an ambition of achieving 70% by the end of the Contract Term. The Council is looking for a Provider who has experience of running similar services and can achieve the social value benefits identified in the Invitation to Tender. The Provider will be providing a paid service to customers, and will be expected to provide a high level of customer satisfaction. The Bulky Household Waste Collection Services contract will commence from April 2018, for a period of 5 years, with a possible extension of a further 5 years. The successful Provider will be required to provide, manage and operate a customer appointment system.

tender_title: Dry Recycling Contract
tender_description:
Hartlepool Borough Council (HBC) requires a new dry recycling contract with a suitable organisation for the sorting, processing and sale to end markets of its dry recycling material resources. This contract must continue to support our existing fully co-mingled at the point of kerbside collection strategy. 

HBC will undertake kerbside collection of recyclate in conventional refuse collection vehicles (RCV) but these vehicles will only operate within the Borough of Hartlepool boundary.
For practical purposes on the day of kerbside collection HBC will either tip RCV loads directly at:
• Contractor's MRF within Borough of Hartlepool boundary; or
• Agreed Transfer Station within Borough of Hartlepool boundary for further onward bulk transport by Contractor. HBC currently owns and operates a kerbside collected recyclate transfer station for bulking up purposes prior to transport to current MRF. The costs for operating this facility, if proposed to be used under a new contract, would be factored into the overall tender evaluation process.

The Contract will commence on the 1st April 2021 for an initial period of 24 months will the potential for 3 x 12 month extensions

This tender will be a 1 Stage Process under the Public Contract Regulation 2015 Open Procedure.
Full details of the tender process and evaluation are provided in the tender documents.

Interested Organisations wishing to register an interest and download the tender documents, should apply via the ProContract e-tendering portal.
https://procontract.due-north.com
Registration is Free of charge

All completed documentation for this tender must be uploaded via the ProContract e-tendering portal Only and submitted no later than 14:00 hours on Friday 12th February 2021.
Late submissions will not be accepted. (Postal and e-mail submissions will also not be accepted.)

tender_title: Sale, Collection and Processing of Mixed Glass
tender_description:
The City of Bradford Metropolitan District Council (the Council) is seeking to source a suitably licensed contractor to deliver the Service which is composed of the collection, keeping, and recycling of Mixed Glass (Recyclable Waste) from the Council's Collection Point. The contract is required to start approximately 1st April 2021 and will run for a fixed period of two years until 31st March 2023 with the option to extend for a further one year period. The Contractor will collect the Recyclable Waste from the Council for a fixed rate per tonne which will track the published market rate each month.

The Contractor will be responsible for the collection, keeping and recycling of approximately 600 to 800 tonnes per month (7200 to 9600 per annum) of Recyclable Waste in line with current methods and regulations. The Recyclable Waste will be collected in loose piles from the Collection Point by the Contractor.

Bidders should note that there is some contamination associated with the Recyclable Waste as we are not able to remove some elements of paper, organics or moisture etc. associated with comingled collections. Contamination has been analysed and proven to be in the region of up to 30% to 40%. Bidders must take this level into account when submitting their bid as they will be responsible for the processing and disposal of any contamination that can't be recycled.

tender_title: Framework for Service and Testing of Domestic Water Systems
tender_description:
The work covered by this contract is intended to meet the continual servicing and monitoring requirements of Approved Code of Practice L8 (the control of legionella bacteria in water systems) and HSG274 to minimise the risk from legionella bacteria and the scalding risk from hot water.

Essentially the purpose is to ensure that all domestic hot water and cold water systems are maintained in a safe and hygienically satisfactory condition through a process involving biannual inspection and testing.

For the purpose of the tender the systems to be covered by this contract are hot and cold domestic systems, together with any permanently connected equipment (e.g. Rainwater Systems) but excluding air conditioning equipment, swimming pools and hydrotherapy pools.

Single Supplier Framework.

tender_title: WCC- Commercial Waste Collection Service
tender_description:
The Authority requires Commercial Waste Collection from Warwickshire County Council properties including general and recycled waste streams. 

The initial contract term will be 2 years however the Authority reserves the right to extend the contract by further periods not exceeding 48 months. The contract will have a maximum possible term of 72 months. 

This contract covers approximately 70 sites throughout Warwickshire. However, Warwickshire County Council reserves the right to add or remove sites from the contract as a result of properties being sold or acquired.   Any supplier will be required to work with the Council and adapt its services as the Council manages and repurposes it property estate during the Covid 19 pandemic and afterwards as working practices change. 

An estimated contract value of £600,000 is based over a 6 year contract and considers a scale of service similar to pre-covid pandemic levels. At present a significant percentage of the property estate is not operational which effects the value. Any successful supplier will be required to be flexible and work with the Council as it manages its estate. 

This procurement exercise will be run electronically using the Council's e-tendering system (CSWJETS). To participate in this procurement bidders must register and express an interest at https://intendhost.co.uk/csw-jets/aspx/Home 
Once registered, all correspondence for this procurement process must be via the Correspondence function. However, if you are unable to register with the website please email procurement@warwickshire.gov.uk . All documentation and further information regarding the procurement can be found on this system. The estimated contract value is based on services received before the Covid 19 pandemic and the actual value will be realised as the Council manages and reopens it property estate.

tender_title: LPS CORP - Provision of Maintenance Services for Leachate Collection and Treatment Systems
tender_description:
The Authority is inviting tenders for the provision of maintenance services for the Authority's leachate collection and treatment systems. 

The Authority operates eight waste landfill sites throughout the county of Lancashire. The leachate collection and treatment systems at each site are designed to collect and/or collect and treat leachate prior to its discharge to foul sewer. A leachate is any liquid that has passed through materials and has extracted solutes, suspended solids or any other component of the material through which it has passed. In this case the leachates extract components from the landfill waste and thus become harmful to the environment and may give rise to explosive atmospheres within the public sewer network unless it is suitably treated.  
 
The performance of the Council's landfill drainage treatment systems is regulated by United Utilities Plc and the Environment Agency. The Authority has a responsibility to manage closed landfill sites as well as enforcing environmental standards, as per various legislative requirements such as Environmental Protection Act 1990, Environmental Permitting Regulations 2010 and Water Industry Act 1991. Therefore it is important that the systems designed to achieve these responsibilities are effectively cleaned and maintained.  
 
The Services involve pipe work and sewer jetting, leachate sump and tank cleaning, lagoon cleaning, aeration pad replacements, and additional services as requested by the Authority from time to time. Additional services includes scope for out-of-hours work although in practice this is a rarity.
classification_description: Sewage, refuse, cleaning and environmental services

tender_title: School Meals Catering
tender_description:
Bracknell Forest Borough Council wishes to establish a framework agreement for the provision of school meals catering. The framework agreement will be let for an initial period of three years with an option to extend for a further year. This will be a framework agreement with individual call-off contracts between the contractor and schools.

Initially the framework will cover 11 primary schools in Bracknell Forest with a combined roll number of around 3,800 pupils. Total meals sales in the school year 2017/18 were 332,000 and all sites have full production kitchens.

The framework agreement will be open for other Berkshire schools to join later should they wish to at any subsequent point of the framework's duration.

Main features of the new framework:
•	Meals will meet the School Food Regulations for school lunches and the Caroline Walker guidelines for portion sizes. 
•	Meals will be made using fresh ingredients and prepared on the day.
•	Low sugar and low-fat levels alternatives used 
•	Free of artificial colours and additives wherever possible.
•	Vegetarian options to be imaginative and offer variety.
•	Fresh and seasonal produce to be used in menus.
•	Local sourcing of foods if possible. 

Applicants should be aware that all staff working in schools will require DBS (enhanced level) checks and the staff will be required to give their written permission for such checks to be performed.

The total estimated framework value ranges between £2,000,000 (2 million GBP) and £6,000,000 (6 million GBP) depending on framework and call-off contract lengths and take up by other Berkshire schools.

Organisations must register their interest on the South East Business Portal site (https://sebp.due-north.com/ ) in order to receive any changes or notifications issued by the Council during this tender process. The Council will not be held responsible for lack of communication to any organisation who does not register their interest.  Clarification questions can also be sent through this site.

This will be a restricted two-stage process. Stage 1 is the Selection Questionnaire for tenderer selection and, if successful, at stage 1, organisations will be invited to tender at stage 2.

Hopwood Community Primary School is based in the Borough of Rochdale and enrols pupils from the ages 3 to 11. There are currently 406 pupils on roll.  

The school is seeking to create a partnership with a suitably qualified and experienced catering provider based on openness, honesty, trust and a mutual desire to develop and deliver a standard of catering to pupils, staff and visitors that matches the excellent level of education already in place. It is important that any company accepting this invitation to participate understands and respects this approach and commits to fully supporting the school to achieve its objective of providing service excellence at all times.

This is an opportunity for a contract caterer to enter into a partnership with the School. Any eventual contract will commence on 28th October 2019 until 31st August 2020 with the option to extend annually for a further 3 years.

tender_title: CP1585-18 Needle and Syringe Equipment Provider (NSP) Service - Devon and Torbay
tender_description:
The main aim of this service is to reduce the transmission of viruses and other infections caused by sharing injecting equipment, such as HIV, Hepatitis B and C.  In turn, this will reduce the prevalence of blood-borne viruses and bacterial infections, so benefiting wider society. 
(NICE Public Health Guideline PH52 issued March 2014)
We wish to commission a Supplier to deliver the highest quality services for the provision of needles, syringes and other injecting paraphernalia to the Local Authority-commissioned Needle & Syringe Programme (NSP) providers in Devon (both pharmacies and specialist needle and syringe provision) and Torbay (both pharmacies and at the custody suite). This includes the collection and safe disposal of used injecting equipment from NSP providers. This Public Health programme provides a harm reduction intervention which aims to facilitate a reduction in drug-related morbidity/mortality, drug related litter and positively impact upon anti-social behaviours and drug-related crime, and support people towards sustainable recovery.  Bidders are invited to a launch event for this opportunity to familiarise themselves with the tender documentation and process.  This event will take place in Exeter on the morning of 05.06.2018.  Interested bidders should email procurementpeople-mailbox@devon.gov.uk to confirm attendance names and numbers.  This email should only be used to arrange attendance at this event.

tender_description:

It is anticipated a maximum of 5 Contractors will be appointed to the Framework for each individual Lot. There are 10 Lots in total. The Framework will operate by the council deciding operationally how best to utilise the service taking into account the contract cost, distance to travel, capacity and availability.

This Framework is being let by Middlesbrough Council to deliver services across the Middlesbrough area. The Framework is open to  Hartlepool Borough Council, Redcar and Cleveland Borough Council and Stockton-on-Tees Borough Council. These authorities may choose to utilise this Framework if they have Waste Processing Service requirements in the contract period and will be responsible for fulfilling their own obligations. 
The estimated total value is based on all authorities utilising the contract. Middlesbrough Council approx value is £50,000 per Lot GBP.

tender_title: QU324  - Service and Maintenance Contract for Instant Hot & Chilled Water Taps & Units  - AWARD
tender_description:
The Council is proposing to award a 3-year agreement for the servicing, maintenance and replacement of a number of instant hot & chilled water hydro taps and hydro boil units within its CAB portfolio managed by Birmingham Property Services (BPS). This 3-year contract period will be from 13th April 2020 until 12th April 2023. The contract commencement date may change as a result of any required minor amends to the procurement timeline. 
      
      The Council requires a fully inclusive parts and labour service cover for all units which will include as a minimum requirement:
      
      o Two service visits per annum (one in each 6-month period)
      
      Within each 6 monthly service visit, the following maintenance operations shall be undertaken:
      
      o scale management
      o filter and sanitising
      
      The current number of units in operation across all the below listed CAB locations are:
      
      Hot and Chilled Water Hydro Tap units x 64 
      
      Current Specification includes:
      o BC160/175G4 Hydro Tap G4 Classic boiling chilled 160/175 bright chrome for work
      o ZT008 Integrated Tap Font for Hydro Tap G4 Classic & Elite Bright Chrome
      o HE45004 Water Block and Reset device
      
      Chilled Water only Hydro Tap unit x 1
      
      Current Specification includes:
      o C175G4 G4 Chilled Only Hydro Tap Chrome Finish 
      o HTRPINS Replacement Installation 
      o 90915UK Integrated Tap Font for Hydro Tap G4 Classic & Elite Bright Chrome 
      o HE45004 Water Block and Reset device 
      
      Hydro Boil units x 18
      
      Current Specification includes:
      A Hydro Boil Unit (mix of HP007, HS005, 307552 and HP 107).
      
      The Council will be using its free to use e-tendering system (in-tend) for the administration of this procurement process and potential suppliers must register with the system to be able to express an interest. If you wish to express an interest in this opportunity please click on the following link to access https://in-tendhost.co.uk/birminghamcc/ and submit your details to register. You will then be sent details on how to log on which will enable you to download all relevant quotation documentation.  
      
      If you are unable to register with In-tend or have any questions or problems on how to use this web site please either email us at: cps@birmingham.gov.uk or call CPS Helpdesk on 0121 464 8000.
      
      Your completed quotation submission should be returned by noon on 31st March 2020  via the 'in-tend' system https://in-tendhost.co.uk/birminghamcc

tender_title: Maintenance of sewage pumping stations at five Worcestershire County Council Managed Caravan Sites. - AWARD
tender_description:
Place Partnership Ltd. on behalf of Worcestershire County Council invite suitable, qualified and experienced maintenance and sewage pumping contractors to carry out the pre preventative maintenance to plant and equipment at five corporate managed caravan sites.
      To carry out three planned preventative maintenance visits (PPM) annually, period of contract three years.
      The successful supplier will need the capability and provision to deliver a direct 24/7/365 out of hours emergency response service (including public and bank holidays)
      Form of Contract: JCT Measured Term Contract 2016
      To register your interest or to download all tender documents please visit the Worcestershire County Council e-procurement portal at: www.in-tendhost.co.uk/worcestershire
      It is on this basis that we invite suitable contractors to provide a full turn-key project compliant quotation, to deliver this project within set time scales.
      All tender documents must be uploaded to the portal by the due date as late returns will not be accepted.
      Tenders and supporting documents shall be in English and any contract subsequently entered in to shall be subject to English Law.
      Please note that the Supplier is responsible for obtaining all information necessary for the preparation of the tender submission. All cost, expenses and liabilities incurred by the Supplier in connection with the preparation of their submission, the Form of Tender and Pricing Schedule shall be borne by the Supplier.

tender_title: CBC-1092-T-CE Food Waste Treatment and Disposal (including Grass Cuttings Disposal) - AWARD
tender_description:
Central Bedfordshire Council is a unitary authority with responsibility for collecting and disposing of municipal waste, including Food Waste. This is currently collected separately from properties in the north of the area, comprising approximately 63,736 households.
      
      As part of the Councils new Waste Collection Contract, it is anticipated Food Waste Collections will be rolled out to residents in the south of the area, compromising approximately 55,550 households. 
      
      Central Bedfordshire Council invites tenders for the treatment and disposal of separately collected food waste. The food waste is of good quality and there have been no incidents of rejected loads from the current contract provider. 
      
      Lot 1 - Food Waste Disposal - North of Authority Area (please see map in Appendix 2a). Approximately 5,000t a year. Contract start date April 2020. Contract term 3 years + possible 3 year extension 
      
      Lot 2 - Food Waste Disposal - South of Authority Area (please see map in Appendix 2b). As this is a new service no tonnage data is available but the Council anticipate similar yearly . Anticipated contract start date Summer 2020. Contract term 3 years + possible 3 year extension.
      
      Lot 3 - Highways Grass Cuttings Disposal - To treat approximately 1000 tonnes of highways grass cuttings, as this is a new service no historical tonnage data is available. Anticipated contract start date April 2020. Contract term 3 years + possible 3 year extension.
      
      Please note you may bid Lots 1, 2 or 3 individually or combined. Please complete a separate ITT document for each lot.
      
      Tender process - OJEU Open
      
      Help and Support - The Council will provide as much support and information as it can to help guide you through the Tender process.  Questions asked together with the response, will be made available to all tenderers to ensure a fair and consistent approach to all. If there is anything you are not sure of or need clarification on, please send a correspondence using the 'In-Tend' Portal tendering system.
      
      Deadline for receipt of Tenders - 12 noon, 3rd January 2020
      
      Return of Tender - Completed Tenders and attachments should be submitted electronically, by the due date via our "In-Tend" electronic tendering system. Tenders must be uploaded via the "My Return" section of the system. Tenders submitted through the correspondence facility will not be considered. 
      
      Your Tender must be submitted via the In-Tend system by no later than 12:00 noon on 2nd January 2020. Tenders received after that time will be excluded.
                                      
      Target contract commencement date or delivery date - 1st April 2020 (Lot 1), 1st October 2020 (Lot 2 & 3)

tender_title: Collection and Processing of Baled Cardboard
tender_description:
The City of Bradford Metropolitan District Council (the Council) is seeking to source a suitably licensed contractor to deliver the Service which is composed of the collection, keeping, and recycling of Baled Cardboard from the Council's Collection Point. The contract is required to start 9th November 2020 and will run for a fixed period of three years until 31st October 2023. The Contractor will purchase the Recyclable Waste from the Council for a fixed rate per tonne which will track the published market rate each month.

The Contractor will be responsible for the collection, keeping and recycling of approximately 80 tonnes per month (960 per annum) of Baled Cardboard in line with current methods and regulations. The bales weigh approx. 500kgs each and we anticipate 40 x bales to one curtain-sided load.

tender_title: P0621 - Framework for the Provision of Mobile Catering Services for Parks - AWARD
tender_description:
The Council wishes to establish a Framework Agreement for the provision of mobile catering services in Council parks. 
      
      There are a total of 55 pitches which are either ice cream only, hot & cold food, and/or hot food only. The number of pitches in each park varies from multiple in a park to an individual pitch in smaller parks. Bidders can submit for one, multiple or all pitches. Each pitch will have an operating licence granted for a period of 4 years until 2023.
      
      Prospective operators must be registered with their Local Authority as a food business and will be expected to meet all Food Safety requirements as laid out in Food Safety and Hygiene (England) Regulations 2013 and the Food Information Regulations 2014. Mobile food operators must have a rating of 4 or 5 under the Food Hygiene Rating Scheme. Sub-licencing of the operating licence granted is expressly prohibited.
      
      The Framework Agreement will last for 4 years.
      
      The Council will be using its free to use e-tendering system (in-tend) for the administration of this procurement process and potential suppliers must register with the system to be able to express an interest. If you wish to express an interest in this opportunity please click on the following link to access https://in-tendhost.co.uk/birminghamcc/ and submit your details to register which will enable you to download all relevant Invitation to Tender (ITT) documentation.  
      
      To help suppliers that may be struggling with user guidance / access of the Intend Portal for help and instructions please see the Supplier user Guide on Intend or contact the CPS helpdesk on 0121 464 8000 or email cps@birmingham.gov.uk. 
      
      Following this if suppliers are still having issues we will allocate Monday 30th September to provide one to one instructional demonstrations. Please note this is for guidance on how to use the Intend system ONLY  (i.e. how you register, downloading the tender documents, how to ask clarifications etc.). These one to one sessions WILL NOT be  around the tender itself or answering questions on the project or completing registration directly for suppliers. Suppliers will need to bring their own laptop for access requirements.
      
      If you would like to book a one to one session on how to use the Intend portal on Monday 30th September please contact the CPS helpdesk on 0121 464 800 or email cps@birmingham.gov.uk to book a time slot.
      
      Your completed tender submission should be returned by 12:00 noon on 4th October 2019 via the 'In-tend' system https://in-tendhost.co.uk/birminghamcc

tender_title: Worcestershire Mineral Site Allocations Development Plan Document: Habitat Regulations Assessment - AWARD
tender_description:
Worcestershire County Council (WCC) is the Mineral Planning Authority (MPA) for the county of Worcestershire. WCC's Minerals and Waste Planning Policy team is preparing a Mineral Site Allocations Development Plan Document (DPD). This will form part of the Development Plan for Worcestershire alongside the Worcestershire Minerals Local Plan (MLP) and other relevant Development Plan Documents.
      
      Once adopted, the DPD will be used by the MPA to determine applications for mineral development. The City, Borough and District Councils in Worcestershire will also use it to make decisions on other types of planning applications that could sterilise sites allocated in this DPD.
      
      The Mineral Site Allocations DPD will provide local policies to allocate specific sites and preferred areas for mineral extraction. These will be used alongside the policies in the Minerals Local Plan to assist with the delivery of steady and adequate supply of minerals. 30 sites have been promoted for consideration in the DPD.
      
      Worcestershire County Council (WCC), as the competent authority in relation to Worcestershire Mineral Site Allocations DPD, is seeking a suitably experienced consultant to undertake and prepare documents recording a Habitat Regulations Assessment (HRA) for the Minerals Site Allocations DPD.If you wish to view the documents for this opportunity please click `Express Interest`. 
      
      Following this, if you wish to apply for this opportunity please click `Opt in` which will then enable you to view and complete the Standard Questionnaire and upload the relevant documents.
      
      After uploading all required documents and completing the questionnaire(s) please remember to press the `Submit your Return` button at the bottom of the page.  
      
      Suppliers will receive a system generated email to confirm successful submission of their return.
      
      Any questions or clarification should be conducted via `Correspondence` through this portal.

tender_title: Reactive Maintenance Framework: Drainage 2019
tender_description:
The Scope of the Reactive Maintenance Framework: Drainage 2019 (the Framework) is reactive maintenance and associated work (E.g. call out to attend main drain blockage requiring rodding) to the Client's own properties and to properties of Customers. The Customer work is to generate income for the Client so that it may subsidise its public service commitments.

The Client intends to appoint up to 4 (four) Suppliers to each lot of the Framework.

The Client proposes to make this Framework available to eligible contracting authorities and charities within the geographic regions of: Leicestershire (Lot 1 - Leicestershire), Derbyshire, Northamptonshire, Nottinghamshire and Rutland (Lot 2 - The East Midlands) and Staffordshire, Warwickshire and West Midlands (Lot 3 - The West Midlands)

The Framework is intended to be used by the Client or eligible contracting authorities (the Customers) that it grants access. The Customers can include but are not limited to schools, academies, universities, district councils, county councils, city councils, libraries, police forces, fire brigades and charities or similar organisations.

It is not possible to ascertain the precise value which may be generated via the Client and Customers. However, based on the financial year 17/18 the Client's spend was £50,000. The value may increase as a result of the following:

a) the Client increasing its own Client/Property portfolio
b) budgets made available to the Client
c) successful Joint Bidding defined in 2.4
d) where new Customer's call off from the Framework
e) the Client experiences consecutive failures across several sites resulting in a higher volume of call outs

It is anticipated that the majority of Work Orders for the Client will be in the range of £0 to £5,000.

The anticipated framework commencement date is 28.1.2020 for an initial period of 24 months, with an option to extend for a further period of 24 months, in 12 months increments, subject to performance. This will take the maximum framework period to 48 months, ending no later than 17.1.2024.

tender_title: Recycling, Waste Collection, and HWRC Contract
tender_description:
The contract will cover the collection of dry recycling, food waste, garden waste and refuse from households, the collection of dry recycling from bring sites, clinical waste and the management of household waste recycling centres. It will also include commercial waste. The service delivery will commence on 1 March 2017 and will have an initial term of seven (7) years with the provision to extend for one or more periods up to a maximum contract term of 20 years. It is estimated that the total real terms value of the contract will be £49m over the initial contract period.   
The council may provide capital funding for plant and fleet investment.

tender_title: F0239 Birmingham City Council Contract for the Provision of Responsive Repairs & Maintenance Services, Gas Servicing, Capital Improvement Work Programmes including Major Adaptations to Council Housing Stock in the North, South, West-Central and East areas  - AWARD
tender_description:
Under the Housing Act 1985 and the Landlord and Tenant Act 1985 the Council has statutory obligations to carry out the repairs and maintenance of its housing stock. Therefore, the Contracting Authority - Birmingham City Council (the 'Council') - entered into Competitive Dialogue to appoint service providers to deliver the provision of Responsive Repairs & Maintenance Services, Gas Servicing, Capital Improvement Work Programmes including Major Adaptations to Council House Properties and Garages, in the North, South, West-Central, and East areas of Birmingham.  These areas, known as quadrants account for approximately 63,322 properties (excluding garages, communal areas, managed and leaseholder properties but includes 	1,103 TMO’s). Under this procurement, the Council was seeking to appoint a minimum of two and a maximum of four contractors to cover the four quadrant areas to carry out the above services.  It was not permissible for contractors to be awarded contract areas totalling more than 34,000 properties. 

The transfer of staff will take place by operation of the Transfer of Undertakings (Protection of Employment) Regulations 2006 (“TUPE”). 

The contracts were procured using the Competitive Dialogue Procedure and will be for an initial term of four years, with the option to extend for up to two periods of two years each, subject to satisfactory performance and negotiation of satisfactory commercial terms. 

These contracts do not commit or offer any guarantee to the level of expenditure, changes in the volume of job categories or the volume or mix of work included in the Competitive Dialogue suite of document.

There was a mandatory requirement for all successful contractors to adopt and become signatories to all the principles contained in the Birmingham Business Charter for Social Responsibility. (BBC4SR).
