WME 002 - A Framework Agreement for the Supply of Electricity on a Flexible Basis and the Provision of Associated Services
tender_description:
This is an award notice for a framework agreement for the supply of electricity on a flexible basis and the provision of associated services to the customers of West Mercia Energy (WME) in its constituent authorities' areas of Shropshire, Herefordshire, Telford & Wrekin and Worcestershire together with other customers of West Mercia Energy (current and potential) as identified in the Instructions for Tendering document.
      The framework agreement is with one Contractor and will commence on 1st December 2018 for a period up to 31 March 2024, allowing for forward purchasing for the supply period, with the period of supply commencing 1st April 2020.
buyer_name: West Mercia Energy (A Local Authority Joint Committee of Shropshire Council, Worcestershire County Council, Telford & Wrekin Council and Herefordshire Council).

tender_title: The Collection, Transportation & Treatment of Wood Waste - RFQ 15220725
tender_description: Lancashire County Council wishes to procure services for the collection, transportation and treatment of wood waste arising from Household Waste Recycling Centres located in the administrative county of Lancashire.

tender_title: CETE020 Collection of Waste Electrical and Electronic Equipment (WEEE)
tender_description: Derbyshire County Councils and Derby City Councils are seeking a WEEE Producer Compliance Scheme partner to handle the collection, treatment and disposal of WEEE from DCF's in the city and county with effect from 1 April 2019. The purpose of this tender exercise is to provide free collection, treatment and environmentally sound disposal of WEEE from ten local authority Household Waste Recycling Centres and four waste transfer loading stations in the city and county designated as DCF's during the Contract Period.  The appointed PCS partner must comply with the WEEE Regulations 2013 and BIS "The Code of Practice" (March 2014) as amended and any amendments or revisions to these regulations made during the Contract Period.

tender_title: CPU 3248 Household Waste and Recycling Centre Management and Operation
tender_description: The council operates one Household Waste & Recycling Centre located in the southeast part of the city with a throughput during 2017-18 in excess of 7,000 Tonnes. The service operates seven days a week 52 weeks a year with the exception of Christmas Day, Boxing Day and New Years day, all other Bank Holidays the site is expected to remain open, and the contractor should refer to 'Normal Opening Hours at 4.18.0 for contract requirements around this point. The site accepts a wide range of materials for recycling and disposal from the public and various charitable organisations as well as from the Waste collection authority (WCA). This site does not operate any form of permit / restriction on residents' legitimate use. Tenders are invited for the supply of services in respect of Household Waste & Recycling Centre (HWRC) management & operation.  The successful supplier will be responsible for providing this service, liaising closely with the Contract Manager at Nottingham City Council. The Council is committed to providing high quality, value for money services and will evaluate each Tender accordingly. The Council is seeking a Contract arrangement that will be able to adapt and respond to changes in HWRC Services (quality and quantity of Recyclable Materials and Wastes, and sustainability).

tender_title: Provision of Closed Landfill Sites Maintenance and Monitoring Contract
tender_description: This opportunity is advertised via The Chest https://www.the-chest.org.uk/ The Council wishes to appoint a contractor to manage and monitor all sites that the Council is responsible for, for routine gas, leachate, surface water and groundwater monitoring and routine maintenance of a network of 35 closed landfill sites across Cumbria to ensure they are managed and maintained in accordance with legislation.

ENGIE Services Ltd is seeking tenderers who can supply electricity and gas products. Only suppliers who can supply electricity and gas products will be considered for this opportunity. 

The tender is divided into lots and tenderers can bid for one or both lots, The ideal scenerio would be to award both lots to one supplier. However, the Authority recognises that not all suppliers can supply both commodities.

tender_title: Waste Paper and Card Haulage and Treatment
tender_description: Wigan Council is seeking a suitably qualified and experienced provider to manage the haulage and treatment of kerbside collected paper and card. The contractor will be expected to collect the waste from Wigan Council's Waste Transfer Station and transfer it to its own facility for treatment. This facility must operate in accordance with applicable legislation and have the capacity to accept all of Wigan's paper/card waste daily. The contractor shall ensure the highest level of recycling is achieved, with waste sorted into marketable products that meet the standards of the paper and card recycling industry. Wigan Council collects approximately 11 000 tonnes of paper and card waste per annum.  The solution will need to consider that the current contamination level is estimated at 8%. The proposed contract will be for a period of 2 years with an option to extend for 2 further periods of 2 years each. Submissions are only accepted by the Chest procurement portal https://www.the-chest.org.uk/

tender_title: Biomass Fuel Supply
tender_description: Buckinghamshire County Council (BCC) has been operating 2 biomass boilers since 2010 and a further 9 were installed between October and December 2014. BCC has a requirement for the supply of UK sourced, virgin timber, 6mm ENPlus A1 pellet standard for use in Herz Pellet Boilers across 11 sites in their region. BCC operate and manage the biomass boilers on behalf of the sites so this fuel contract will be directly with BCC and day to day contact, ordering and payments will be carried out by BCC.

tender_title: Provision of Commercial Waste Recycling Collection and Disposal
tender_description:
The Isle of Wight Council ("the Authority") invites Tenders from suitably qualified suppliers ("Potential Suppliers") for the provision of Commercial Waste Recycling Collection and Disposal Service from all Isle of Wight Council buildings. This procurement follows the OJEU Open Tender Procedure under the Public Contract Regulations 2015.

The contract will be for the collection of commercial waste and recycling from Council run properties across all of the Isle of Wight, consisting of Offices, Libraries, Fire Stations, and Care Homes. Collection will range from waste bags, bins ranging from 240 Litre to 1100 Litre and enclosed containers for bulky items.

The aim of this contract is to centralise the Authority's Commercial waste provider and increase the recycling rate from Council properties.

tender_title: Skip, Waste Removal, Disposal, Segregation & Recycling Service
tender_description: This was a collaborative OJEU procurement and a contract has been awarded to provide a Skip, Waste Removal, Disposal, Segregation & Recycling Services to Barnsley Metropolitan Borough Council and Berneslai Homes Ltd. The contract will have a maximum duration of 4 years from the 1st May 2020 until the 30th April 2024.
buyer_name: Barnsley Metropolitan Borough Council and Berneslai Homes Limited

tender_title: WCC - Composting of Garden Waste
tender_description:
Warwickshire County Council is seeking to appoint a contractor to compost garden waste arising in Warwickshire. The Contractor must provide a suitable delivery point and ensure the garden waste is composted.

Full details and tonnages provided in the Invitation to Tender document.

The initial contract term is 3 years, however the authority reserves the right to extend the contract by further periods up to a maximum of 36 months.

The procurement process will be run electronically using the Authority's tendering
portal. https://intendhost.co.uk/csw-jets/aspx/Home

Registration onto the portal is free and all relevant documentation will be available to bidders. Should bidders have queries regarding the procurement exercise, they are required to contact the Authority using the Correspondence function on the tendering portal.
classification_description: Sewage, refuse, cleaning and environmental services

tender_title: PAN2512 - Weed Spraying Services
tender_description: The Authority require weed control services to be provided on all Authority-owned or controlled highways. The total distance covered is approximately 1500 kilometres which includes both sides of the highway and its accompanying pathways etc. The weed control programme normally takes place three times a year (in spring, summer and autumn) and each seasonal spray is to last no more than five weeks. The Authority reserves the right, at its own discretion and via a Change Control Note, to amend the Contract for biannual weed treatment taking place in spring and summer only.

tender_title: SC20026 - Highways Mechanical Arisings (HMA) Processing Services
tender_description:
As a Waste Disposal Authority, Kent County Council has a statutory responsibility to dispose of waste collected by the Waste Collection Authorities, of which one type of waste is Highway Mechanical Arisings ("HMA"), or street sweepings collected by a street sweeper vehicle. KCC requires new supply arrangements for the processing and disposal of HMA, with the new services commencing on 1 May 2021.
The supplier will be required to have in place:
• a waste processing facility with appropriate permitting and planning permissions;
• an electronic weighbridge for the weighing-in of material delivered to their facility to provide the Council with the appropriate management information (including weigh-loader transaction listings);
• policies and procedures that recover materials in accordance with the waste hierarchy to maximise reuse and recycling and to avoid sending any waste to landfill; and
• robust service contingency plans to ensure continuity of services in the event of plant failure, etc.
A full specification of requirements will be provided to tenderers as part of the Invitation to Tender stage of this procurement procedure.

tender_title: Processing of Green Waste Service
tender_description:
The Borough Council of Newcastle-under-Lyme and Stafford Borough Council as part of their waste strategy programme are seeking tenders for the composting of Green Waste. The Contractor is to supply a composting site(s)/transfer facility(s) for the acceptance of green garden materials and Municipal green waste to be composted.
The contract shall be let in two lots, with Lot 1 effective from no later than 01.07.2016 to 01.07.2020 with a possible extension of two, two year periods, upon successful delivery and agreement; and Lot 2 effective from no later than 04.02.2016 to 03.02.2018 with a possible extension of three, two year periods, upon successful delivery and agreement
The site must be appropriately licensed and able to accept the compostable waste effective from the start date of the contract. The Borough Council of Newcastle under Lyme (NULBC) and Stafford Borough Council (SBC) shall separately deliver the waste to the site(s) or transfer facility(s). The composting operations shall comply with the guidelines and regulations published by DEFRA and the Government. This includes an appropriate waste management licence issued by the Environment Agency and other related permissions associated with composting operations. The compost produced shall meet a recognised standard and shall be marketed as a product designed for use in the private or public gardening sector or alternatively used beneficially on land for the improvement of agriculture and where possible made available within the local communities to each respective Council.

tender_title: District Heating Systems Planned and Reactive Maintenance and Associated Services
tender_description:
The Heat Management Contract consists of the maintenance of 141 Housing sites of which 40 are Multi-storey blocks of flats that are part of district heating systems; 3 are cold water distribution pumped sites and 58 are site based laundry plant rooms.

The services covering weekly tests at all blocks, fan maintenance, twice yearly boiler servicing, tank cleaning, electrical testing, monitoring of underground mains and general painting cleaning of all sites.

Included also is Reactive Maintenance which includes radiator replacement, Hot & Cold water stop taps and  main control valves outside of Plant Rooms and other associated works.

Heat management 

This is estimated to be worth between £335,000 and £353,000 per annum

Legionella

Consists of twice yearly water sampling for Legionella and other bacteria and site risk assessment reports. This service must conform to ACOP L8 (Fourth edition). This will involve 394 visits to 197 locations to undertake these tests and the estimated value of this service is between £167,000 and £225,000 per annum.

Fire Risers

Consists of the annual servicing of Fire Risers in accordance with BS 9990:2015 and servicing of Bin Room Fire Sprinklers twice yearly in accordance with BS EN 12845. ). The Fire Risers work will involve annual visits to 59 locations to undertake these tests and the estimated value of this service is between £16,500 and  £17,600 per annum. The Fire Sprinklers work will initially involve twice yearly visits to 53 locations rising to 74 locations over the first 2 years of the contract and the estimated value of this service is between £26,180 and £36,300 per annum.

Bristol City Council is looking for an experienced contractor to carry out Planned Maintenance & Responsive Repairs to occupied properties citywide, managed by Housing Delivery.
classification_description: Steam, hot water and associated products

tender_title: CBC-0994-FW-TS Greenleas School Catering Services - AWARD
tender_description:
Greenleas School - Catering Services
      
      Please note timeline with regards to questions and submission dates.
      
      All communication/correspondence and clarifications must be sent via the In-tend portal. Please do not contact the Service area directly.
      
      Please view the 'Clarification' tab for any updates or responses to questions asked.
      
      The Council will provide as much support and information as it can to help guide you through the Tender process.  Questions asked together with the response, will be made available to all suppliers tendering, to ensure a fair and consistent approach to all. If there is anything you are not sure of or need clarification of, then please contact us using the correspondence facility within the In-tend electronic tendering system.
      
      Please ensure that you inform us of your decision to participate. To submit a response, you will be required to Opt In.
      
      Opt In- This will confirm to us of your involvement and your intention to submit a return.
      
      Opt Out- This will confirm to us that you are not submitting a return. You will be able to provide a reason as to your decision and have the option to cease any system-generated communication. You will be able to opt back in at any point. 
      
      Target contract commencement date: July 2019
      Contract term: 5 +1+1+1+1 Optional

tender_title: CCTV & ROOT CUTTING CONTRACT 2019
tender_description:
Leicestershire County Council (the Council) is seeking to identify and appoint 1 contractor to provide a CCTV and root cutting top up service on highway drains located in the county. The service will be carried on highway drains 150 mm diameter and above, generally not more than 2,0 m deep and located in and around the employers highways network.The service consists of providing the following teams to work on the employers highway drainage network:

- CCTV survey team,

- hydraulic root cutting with Jet / Vacuumation units,

- robotic root cutting at locations where hydraulic root cutting has not proved satisfactory,

- temporary traffic management on roads up to and including 30 mph and not requiring traffic lights for safe working. The employer provides all other traffic management.
classification_description: Sewage, refuse, cleaning and environmental services

The Council's current fleet requiring this service contains 32 Refuse Collection Vehicles (RCVs) + 2 Skip Wagons

tender_title: WSCC DR - Delivered in Hot Catering Services for Arunside Primary School - AWARD
tender_description:
A contract for the provision of Delivered in Hot School Catering Services, as further described in Document No. 2 (The Specification) is being tendered by West Sussex County Council (WSCC) on behalf of Arunside Primary School.
      
      For the purposes of this Procurement, the term Services is used to describe the entire range of the Services required. The disciplines within that range required for this Procurement are as follows:
      
      • The Service Provider will be required to provide a delivered in hot meal service to the School and will also be required to deliver in crockery as well as remove dirty crockery and associated food/packaging waste.
      • Further details are given in Document 2: Service Specification.
      
      The resulting contract will be available for the sole use of Arunside Primary School.

tender_title: SCC APC The Supply of Transport for School Meals 2021  - AWARD
tender_description:
An open tender process to identify a provider for a reliable service for the supply of transport for school meals to primary schools that do not have kitchen facilities, which represents value for money.  Twelve15 provides schools meals to the majority of Surrey's schools under a contractual basis.  The decision as to the procurement of school meals sits with each individual school. Schools must, by statute, provide free meals for eligible pupils and paid meals as requested. From September 2014 every primary school child in reception, year 1 and year 2, became entitled to a free school meal (Universal Free School Meals [UFSM]). The meals must be nutritious, high quality and freshly prepared using seasonal/local produce.
      
      The contract supports Council's Twelve15 contractual obligations to provide school meals across
      2014, for all state-funded schools, including academies and free schools, to offer a free school lunch to all pupils in reception, year 1 and year 2.

tender_title: Residual Waste Disposal for Bournemouth and Christchurch
tender_description:
The contract is for the treatment/ disposal of the residual waste streams collected from Bournemouth and Christchurch, that is domestic kerbside refuse, litterbins and commercial waste collections. 
The contract has been divided into Lots which are: 
- Lot 1 - Bournemouth Residual Waste
- Lot 2 - Christchurch Residual Waste 
The initial contract is 3 years with 3 options to extend annually a further 3 years (3 + 1 + 1 + 1). Therefore, if all extensions were taken the full length of the contract would be for 6 years.
The anticipated start date of the contract is 1 September 2021.

tender_title: COV - Organic and Inert Waste  - AWARD
tender_description:
Coventry City Council (CCC) is responsible for the collection and disposal of all household waste arising within the boundaries of the City. In addition, the Council operates a successful commercial waste service and waste transfer station.
      Domestic waste collections in the City are currently carried out fortnightly for general household waste, dry mixed recycling and commingled food and garden waste.  
      The Council is looking for a contract for the Inert waste and hardcore produced through its activities and accepted at the city's Household and Waste Recycling Centre (Lot 1.). The treatment of mixed food and garden waste collected from its kerbside collection service (Lot 2.). Food waste (Lot 3.) only and Garden waste (Lot 4) only to form part of this framework agreement, albeit that the Food waste (Lot3.) and Garden waste (Lot 4.) is not currently an immediate requirement. 
      The current contract was let in 2017 and ends on 05/09/2021. This tender is to set up a framework of suppliers for the Councils current activities and for services that may be required during the life of this framework agreement (Lot 3. and 4.). In the event of Lot 3. and 4. becoming a requirement the annual tonnage for Lot 2. would be reduced.
classification_description: Sewage, refuse, cleaning and environmental services

tender_title: Half Hourly and Non-Half Hourly Electricity Supply Contract
tender_description:
Charnwood Borough Council has accessed Eastern Shires Purchasing Organisation (ESPO) Framework Contract 191b/c to renew the Half Hourly and Non-Half Hourly Electricity Supply Contract. 

This contract has an approximate annual consumption of 1.331 million kWh for Half Hourly and 2.019 million kWh for Non-Half Hourly electricity supply. 

The Pan Government Energy Project recommended the use of framework contracts by local authorities, let through central purchasing bodies to gain the benefits of aggregated volumes and flexible purchasing as best practice and to improve risk management. 

The new contract will take effect from the 1st October 2020 and end on 30th September 2024.

tender_title: Waste Management and Recycling
tender_description:
Leighton-Linslade Town Council wishes to appoint a waste management and recycling provider who has recycling capabilities to maximise the amount of recycling from our activities associated with parks management,  cemetery management, market management, office facilities/pavilions and for future sites as and when required.

Please complete the attached PPQ to allow the Town Council to shortlist the providers to a competitive quotation stage. 

Where the evaluation will be based on price, estimated recycling rates, energy recovery and a formal presentation to Council.

tender_title: Framework for Service and Testing of Domestic Water Systems
tender_description:
The work covered by this contract is intended to meet the continual servicing and monitoring requirements of Approved Code of Practice L8 (the control of legionella bacteria in water systems) and HSG274 to minimise the risk from legionella bacteria and the scalding risk from hot water.

Essentially the purpose is to ensure that all domestic hot water and cold water systems are maintained in a safe and hygienically satisfactory condition through a process involving biannual inspection and testing.

For the purpose of the tender the systems to be covered by this contract are hot and cold domestic systems, together with any permanently connected equipment (e.g. Rainwater Systems) but excluding air conditioning equipment, swimming pools and hydrotherapy pools.

Please note this is a Single Supplier Framework.

The anticipated start date of the contract is 27/10/2020. The contract will be for 4 years with two options to extend with each option being 36 months therefore if all extensions were taken the full duration of the contract would be 10 years (4+3+3).

tender_title: ITT for the Provision of a Sole Caterer at Oxford Town Hall
tender_description:
This Contract is for the provision of a sole caterer at Oxford Town Hall. 

Tenderers responding to this opportunity should carefully consider how their response can align with the Council's corporate priorities:
•	Enable an inclusive economy
•	Deliver more, affordable housing
•	Support thriving communities
•	Pursue a zero carbon Oxford

As a minimum, we expect Tenderers to respond with market leading pricing structures which reflect the scope of the commercial opportunities we offer.  Additionally, where there is an opportunity for a sustainable solution, Tenderers are strongly encouraged to offer such solutions, where permitted within the scope of the specification.  

The principal aim of the tender process is to appoint a single Tenderer to the Council who will deliver both financial and efficiency benefits.  

This Contract is programmed to be awarded on Monday 2 August 2021 for a period of 3 years from Contract commencement with the option for the Council, in its entire discretion, to extend the Contract by a further period of 2 years up to a maximum term of 5 years.
The implementation date is programmed to be Monday 2 August.
classification_description: Catering services for other enterprises or other institutions

tender_description:
Provision of fuel cards and supply of fuel to the Council.
One year contract with three potential 12 month extension periods.

This award is being made under NHS SBS Fuel cards Vehicle Solutions framework (SBS/18/DT/XCB/9322)
classification_description: Petroleum products, fuel, electricity and other sources of energy

tender_title: Solar Framework
tender_description:
Framework for the supply and installation of solar panels across 5 lots with an additional lot for a consultant to carry out post installation checks. Panels to be installed in line with the IET Code of Practice for Grid-connected Solar Photovoltaic Systems.

The Council currently has an allocated £6m of funding to invest in renewal energy, including Solar Panels. The estimated value includes this money, as well as allowances for future funding to be made available over the life of the Framework and for usage by other public sector bodies listed within the Tender pack who may or may not access the Framework.
The framework consists of the following lots:
1.	Domestic Rooftop (minimum 10 homes)
2.	Commercial Rooftop up to 50kW
3.	Commercial Rooftop more than 50kW
4.	Commercial Ground Mounted
5.	Commercial Solar Carport
6.	Post-Installation Quality Assessment

Contractors may bid for and be appointed to any number and combination of Lots 1-5, however Lot 6 is exclusive. Bidders tendering for that Lot may not tender for any other.

The tender documents can be accessed here: https://procontract.due-north.com/Advert/Index?advertId=7a4b1b92-755c-ea11-80ff-005056b64545

tender_title: Owners Agent / Technical Adviser for Brokenbury and Nightingale Park Solar Farms
tender_description:
Torbay Council is intending to provide two separate solar developments within Torbay. One is at a site known as Brokenbury which will be approximately 2MWP and the other will be at a site known as Nightingale Park which will be approximately 3.2MWP. Both are private wire schemes with the intention to provide power to South West Water adjacent to Brokenbury and the South Devon NHS Trust close to Nightingale Park.
As part of the development process the Council is looking to appoint an Owners Agent/Technical Adviser to carry out the roles required in Part 2 Specification.
The Owners Agent will be expected to assist the Council through the various stages to site completion and monitoring.
classification_description: Petroleum products, fuel, electricity and other sources of energy

tender_title: Framework for Decontamination/Deep Cleaning Services
tender_description: The framework agreement is required for deep cleaning of Adult Social Care (ASC) Clients' homes at various locations on the Isle of Wight. A high standard of cleaning will be required, with an absence of soil, dust, dirt, stains, marks and odours. With deep cleans including, but not be limited to sharps disposal, removal and cleansing of bodily fluids, infection control and removal of any bio-hazardous materials to ensure that the property is left clean, looking well-cared for, bright and of pleasing appearance.

tender_title: CBC-0865-T-TS Catering Services for St Andrews Lower School - AWARD
tender_description:
Provision of Catering Services for St Andrews C of E VC Lower School 
      
      St Andrews C of E VC Lower School is looking to appoint an experienced catering company to provide outstanding meals at lunchtime, using quality raw ingredients in dishes that are expertly cooked and beautifully presented with a smile. 
      
      Please note Estimated Contract Value: £750,00.00 - 5 year Contract term + Optional 1+1+1+1 = £600,000.00
      
      Please note timeline with regards to questions and submission dates.
      
      All communication/correspondence and clarifications must be sent via the In-tend portal. Please do not contact the Service area directly.

Questions asked together with the response, will be made available to all suppliers tendering, to ensure a fair and consistent approach to all. If there is anything you are not sure of or need clarification of, then please contact us using the correspondence facility within the In-tend electronic tendering system.
      
      Please ensure that you inform us of your decision to participate. To submit a response, you will be required to Opt In.
      
      Opt In- This will confirm to us of your involvement and your intention to submit a return.
      
      Opt Out- This will confirm to us that you are not submitting a return. You will be able to provide a reason as to your decision and have the option to cease any system-generated communication. You will be able to opt back in at any point. 
      
      Target contract commencement date: 01 January 2019
      Contract Period 5 years + 1+ 1 + 1 + 1 year(s) optional. 
      
      Contract end date: 01/01/2024

tender_title: NEPO215 Collection & Management of Waste Electrical & Electronic Equipment (WEEE) and Post-Consumer Batteries
tender_description: NEPO is seeking to procure a Framework Agreement for the provision of a free of charge service for the collection and management of waste electrical and electronic equipment (WEEE) and post-consumer batteries in line with UK Government WEE Regulations 2013 and the accompanying code of practice. The waste will be collected from a notified list of Designated Collection Facilities's (DCFs) on behalf of the Contracting Authorities within each authority's geographical area. The awarded supplier will supply, service, maintain and replace storage containers needed for the service as well as the collection and transportation of whole units and broken WEEE and batteries to suitable processing facilities, and the further sorting or final disposal of any contaminants arising from the collection and sorting process. As a nil cost service the value of the Framework Agreement is 0 GBP with tenderers being invited from the Environment Agency's list of WEEE approved producer compliance schemes.

tender_title: Green Waste Composting Service for Sefton Council, Knowsley Council, St Helens Council and Wirral Council
tender_description:
This contract is primarily for delivery of a service to Council establishments in The Liverpool City Region (LCR), in particular, Sefton, Wirral, Knowsley and St. Helens. Sefton Council will act as lead Authority for this contractual agreement. Further information about Sefton is available on our website (www.sefton.gov.uk). Other Authority websites include: -
www.sthelens.gov.uk
www.wirral.gov.uk
www.knowsley.gov.uk

There is a possibility that the following Authorities may join this contract during the term: -

•	Halton Borough Council;
•	Liverpool Streetscene Services Ltd (LSSL) / Liverpool City Council; and
•	Cheshire West and Chester Council.

	The composting requirement for all four Councils is currently estimated at 46,500 tonnes per annum. The breakdown per Council is approximately 19,000 tonnes for Sefton, 13,500 tonnes for Wirral, 7,000 tonnes for St Helens and 7,000 tonnes for Knowsley. The tonnage values provided in this document are approximations for evaluation purposes only and cannot be guaranteed. The four Authorities will however, offer contract exclusivity for Green Waste arising for the duration of the contract

	
	2.5.3   In peak season the amount of loose green waste to be delivered in any one week is as follows: 
	
•	Sefton Council - in excess of 650 tonnes;
•	St Helens Council - in excess of 350 tonnes; 
•	Knowsley Council - in excess of 300 tonnes; and 
•	Wirral Council in excess of 1,600 tonnes. 
	
	
	2.5.4	 It is a condition that any site offered for composting as part of this contract will have evidence of planning permission, a full waste management licence/Environmental Permit or any exemption thereof. Any contract award would be conditional on obtaining and evidencing these permissions.
classification_description: Sewage, refuse, cleaning and environmental services

tender_title: Commercial Waste Receipt and Disposal Service
tender_description:
Thanet District Council is seeking to procure a specialist contractor to receive Commercial General Waste,
Commercial Dry Recycling and Commercial Food Waste for Receipt and Disposal. The waste streams will be 
collected by Thanet District Council Commercial Waste Vehicles and transported to the contractor's site for
onward Processing, Reprocessing, Treatment and disposal as appropriate.
The Contract is anticipated to commence on 4th January 2021 for an initial duration of 2 years with a single
option to extend for 24 months at the sole discretion of the Council
classification_description: Non-hazardous refuse and waste treatment and disposal services

tender_title: Northamptonshire Children's' Trust Request for Quote for Children's Homes Catering and Training Services
tender_description:
The Northamptonshire Children's Trust are seeking an experienced Caterer to join our thriving teams at two of our Children's Homes in Northamptonshire. The right candidate will be up to date with all environmental health guidelines and have awareness of allergies and allergens. You will be willing to complete training and refresh knowledge and will hold a level 3 Food Safety qualification. An enhanced DBS is required. 
 

Key responsibilities:

•	To organise, cook and prepare a healthy, balanced diet for children in Welford and Arnold House. Monday, Wednesday and Friday at Arnold House and 
•	Take into consideration daily those children who have special dietary requirements and prepare a suitable alternative. 
•	Prepare a suitably balanced rotating menu taking into account dietary and cultural requirements of the children. 
•	Ensure high standards of hygiene, health and safety is maintained in the kitchen at all times.
•	To work with the young people at Welford House on their cooking skills in line with their Pathway Planning. 


Operational Responsibilities:

•	To be responsible for the day-to-day running of the kitchen, ensuring compliance with registration and legislative requirements at all times.
•	Responsible for the planning and preparation of food to provide meals in accordance with our menus and food policies.
•	Ensure that all individual dietary requirements are catered for.
•	Maintain necessary kitchen procedures and records in accordance with Environmental Health policies and processes.
•	Liaise with Home Manager on the ordering of necessary kitchen equipment. 
•	To undertake any other reasonable catering duties as requested by the Home Manager.
•	Ensure the kitchen and equipment is kept suitably clean at all times including walls, floors and trolleys to transport food following a cleaning schedule. On a daily basis that all crockery, cutlery and cooking utensils are washed in accordance with food safety guidelines. 
•	Ensure that all foods are ready at the specified time and correctly served.
•	To implement and maintain the company's equal opportunities policy ensuring that practice is positive and non-discriminatory. 

To submit a response to our Request for Quotation please fully complete the attached RFQ template and send to tim.morrison@nctrust.co.uk by the deadline of 12.00noon Friday 26th of November 2021. All clarification questions and queries should be directed to the e-mail address above by the deadline specified in the RFQ document Procurement Timetable.

tender_title: Provision of Garden Waste Treatment Services
tender_description: Peterborough City Council (PCC) invites tenders from suitably experienced organisations who can demonstrate knowledge, skill and innovation in the provision of Garden Waste Treatment Services. The Council's garden material is delivered to the Council's Green Waste Transfer Station located in Dogsthorpe from 2 sources: a household kerbside collection and the Householders Recycling Centre (HRC) situated in Fengate. The successful supplier will be responsible for managing the Council's Green Waste Transfer Station, Bulking up, Haulage and Treating the waste in accordance with the Council's Specification. The Transfer of Undertaking (Protection of Employment) (TUPE) Regulations 2006 will apply to this tender, bidders will be required to download, sign and upload, through the Q&A section, a TUPE Undertaking of Confidentiality in the Council's e-procurement system, SourceDogg, before the Council is able to provide the TUPE details and information.

tender_title: Supply of Waste Management Services Y21003
tender_description:
The Framework Agreement covers the provision of comprehensive and innovative waste solutions and Suppliers will be expected to proactively assist in attempts to reduce the quantities of waste sent to landfill and achieve recycling targets. This is in line with the revised Waste (England and Wales) Regulations 2011 that prioritise the waste hierarchy. 

Waste Management Services requirements include, but are not limited to, the following: 

· Intregrated Waste Management 
· General Waste and Recycling 
· Clinical, Chemical, Hazardous and Radioactive Waste 
· Confidential Waste 
· Supply of Wheelie Bins including Compactors/Balers 
· Waste Disposal Authority (WDA) Household Waste Processing

tender_title: Collection and Treatment of Street Cleansing Residues
tender_description:
Lincolnshire County Council is looking for a supplier who is able to collect and treat of street cleanings residues (street sweepings and gully emptying's) for the Lincolnshire area.

Street sweeping and gully emptying material has the European Waste Catalogue (EWC) classification of 20-03-03 'Street Cleaning residue'.

Street Sweepings and Gully Emptying's may include but are not limited to silt, grit, sand, water, broken glass, litter, leaves and other vegetation. It is also likely to contain a range of contaminants such as oil, diesel, small dead animals and salt. They may also include heavy metals, other contaminants and have high leachable organic content.

The supplier will be required to collect waste (street sweepings) from collection points around the Lincolnshire area (Grantham, Sleaford, Boston, Louth and Gainsborough) and transport the waste to the supplier's treatment site. The supplier may also be required to accept direct deliveries to the supplier treatment site.

The supplier will then subject the street sweeping and the gully emptying material to a mechanical and/or biological process that changes its characteristics such that the resulting products and residues of the process can be reclassified to Chapter 19 waste codes (List of Wastes Regulations 2005).

tender_title: CP1694-19 Contract for the provision & management of a recycling centre in Torrington-Devon
tender_description:
The Authority currently has a contract in place for the provision and management of a Recycling Centre inTorrington-Devon-England which expires on 31st March 2020. The Authority therefore wishes to appoint asuccessor Service provider for the provision of the same service.
The Service entails the provision of a suitable recycling centre facility in Torrington, Devon and the management of all its operations in accordance with the provisions of the Contract, in particular Specification Schedule 1.1. The Contractor shall be responsible for the receipt of waste from the members of the public, its salvaging, sorting or processing with a view to maximising the centre's recyclable, recoverable waste and minimising any residual waste.
The Contract will be for an initial service period of five years starting from 1st April 2020 and subject to mutual agreement of the parties may be extended for periods totalling a maximum further 4 years.

tender_title: Refuse and waste related services
tender_description:
Norfolk County Council wishes to procure Waste Transfer Station services for the reception, handling and
storage of local authority collected residual waste. This is in accordance with its statutory duties as the Waste
Disposal Authority for Norfolk or any such duties that may be delegated to the County Council. Onward haulage
for final treatment and/or disposal has already been separately procured.
The transfer stations will also be required to receive a range of other local authority collected materials including
but not limited to plasterboard, tyres and waste electrical and electronic equipment and make arrangements for
their treatment and disposal as appropriate.

tender_title: Lincolnshire County Council's Separated Paper and Card Recycling Contract
tender_description:
Lincolnshire County Council (LCC) is procuring a contract for the collection, haulage and recycling of paper and cardboard. LCC is implementing the separation of paper and cardboard from household recycling in a phased approach over a four year period. This will start with Boston Borough Council in Spring 2021 and it is expected that each of the districts will be rolled out in approximately 6 monthly intervals following this. Alongside the collection of separated at source collections of paper and cardboard the Council is also planning a robust programme of engagement and communication with residents. The paper and cardboard will be presented loose (i.e. it will not be baled).
The contract term is 4 years with 2 further options to extend for 2 years to a maximum term of 8 years.
Full details can be found in the procurement documentation (https://procontract.due-north.com).

tender_title: CPU5004 Clinical Waste Disposal
tender_description: Clinical Waste collected from a variety of locations within the City including private households and residential care homes.

tender_title: Operator of Recycling Transfer Station
tender_description:
The contract is for the operation of a recycling facility, requiring the operator:
• To discharge the COTC aspect of the Permit
• To manage the H&S aspects of the facility in accordance with existing and established procedures, with the assistance of the Council's H&S Advisors
• To coordinate Visitors to the facility
• To make the facility available from 7.00am to 5.30pm M-Fr (Sa/Su as required for service provision)
• To receive deliveries from the Council's recycling collection services
• To provide loading shovel and accredited operator.
• To manage the materials stored within the RTS
• To coordinate and load onward haulage as necessary
• To undertake necessary inspections of facility with regard to the provisions of the Environmental Permit (e.g., materials, segregation, fire watch, dust suppression, etc.)
• To segregate materials to remove contamination and to avoid cross contamination of materials. Provide daily reporting on contamination
• To open up and secure the facility at the end of each working day
• To coordinate and facilitate regular periodic maintenance checks as required and record such inspections.

tender_title: Electrical Testing and Repairs to Corporate Properties & Schools
tender_description:
Reading Borough Council wish to procure the services of a contractor for the provision of electrical testing, servicing and associated repairs to corporate properties and schools, including inspecting and testing fixed electrical installations, inspecting and testing electrical supplies to fuel pumps, PAT testing, inspection and testing of lightning conductors, servicing and maintenance of generators and servicing of solar photovoltaic systems
      
      The contract will cover approximately 224 properties / assets across the borough.
      
      The service will include the provision of an emergency call-out service 365 days a year, 24 hours a day.
      
      The proposed contract will be for an initial period of five (5) years commencing in September 2017, with an option to extend for a further two year extension.
      
      The contracting authority anticipates that the Transfer of Undertaking (Protection of Employment) Regulations 2006 (TUPE) will not apply to this contract.
      
      Please note that once you have expressed interest, you need to confirm your involvement \"Opt-In\" on the PQQ submission tab. This will then provide you with access to the online Selection Questionnaire which must be completed and submitted by the closing date of the opportunity.

•	Four evenly scheduled service visits per annum to sewage pumping stations

Please note this is a Single Supplier Framework.

tender_title: CBC-0957-T-CE Facilities Management of Non-domestic Assets (Corporate Landlord Services) - AWARD
tender_description:
You are invited to tender for Corporate Landlord Services of non-domestic Assets. The proposed contracts will be split into three lots in Hard FM and Soft FM and Minor Projects
      
      The strategic aim is to bring all non-domestic Landlord Services under one central team, giving CBC price certainty through economies of scale, a compliant estate and a service that colleagues across CBC can be proud of.
      
      Hard FM services - Reactive repairs & Emergency works, Capital Projects (up to £20,000) and Compliance Testing
      
      Soft FM services - Cleaning, Catering, Security, Waste (Confidential & Sanitary), Document Storage and Gritting of corporate sites
      
      Minor Projects - Capital Projects between £20,000 - £300,000. This will be a range of services across the estate of Council buildings.
      
      Help and Support - The Council will provide as much support and information as it can to help guide you through the Tender process.  Questions asked together with the response, will be made available to all tenderers to ensure a fair and consistent approach to all. 
      
      If there is anything you are not sure of or need clarification on, please send a correspondence using the 'In-tend' portal tendering system. Deadline for questions closes on Wednesday 9th January 2019, 16:00.
      
      Return of Tender - Completed Tenders and attachments should be submitted electronically, by the due date via our "In-tend" electronic tendering system. Tenders must be uploaded via the "My Return" section of the system. Tenders submitted through the correspondence facility will not be considered. 
      
      Your Tender must be submitted via the In-tend system - Tender return date has been amended to 10:00 am on Wednesday, 16th January 2019 (updated 10th January 2019)Tenders received after that time will be excluded.

tender_title: NEPO302 Gas Supply Framework Agreement
tender_description:
The Association of North East Councils Trading as the North East Procurement Organisation (NEPO) is seekng tenders for gas supply services.  Tenderers must hold a Non-Domestic Supply Licence as issued by OFGEM. The Framework Agreement supply services will include NEPO trading gas on a fully flexible basis (amongst
other products) and the subsequent supply of gas to the NEPO portfolio. Also included within the scope of the Framework Agreement is the provision of Automatic Meter Reading and associated services and systems. The Framework Agreement will also include provisions for assisting in the reduction of consumption and supporting users energy efficiency schemes.

NEPO are using a two-stage competitive procedure with negotiation for this Framework Agreement. The first stage is a Selection Questionnaire which will be used to shortlist organisations. Shortlisted organisations will then be invited to tender in January 2019. The Selection Questionnaire document also contains an ITT overview that sets out the high-level requirements of the Framework Agreement. This document will allow organisations to determine if they are interested in this opportunity and consider whether they have the required capability and capacity to deliver the Framework
Agreement prior to submitting a Selection Questionnaire.
The Framework Contract will be a sole suppier Framework Contract with one Lot. Those organisations shortlisted from Selection Questionnaire and invited to tender will be evaluated in accordance with the Award Critera contained within the Invitation to Tender documents. NEPO may then negotiate with an organisation(s)
in line with the requirements of the Competition with Negotiation procedure. NEPO also reserve the right not to enter into negotiation and accept an initial Tender. The opportunity can be accessed via the NEPO eTender system. Suppliers wishing to be considered for this
contract must register their expression of interest and submit a tender through the NEPO eTender System. If not already registered, candidates should register on the NEPO eTender system at https://procontract.duenorth.com/Register. Tenders must be submitted using the link above. Tenders submitted via postal or email
methods will not be accepted. If you require time-critical assistance on submitting your Tender please contact the System Support Team on 0330 0050352. For not time-critical issues, such as passwords, general account queries and location of information etc, please contact Proactics Supplier Support Helpdesk Ticketing System
(http://proactis.kayako.com/) and select ProContract V3 support. You will then need to log in or submit a ticket to register your issue. Alternatively, you can email ProContractSuppliers@proactics.com . This will automatically log a support ticket on the Proactics Supplier Support Helpdesk.
classification_description: Petroleum products, fuel, electricity and other sources of energy

tender_title: CP 1875-20 Contract for the operation of Devon County Council's waste transfer facility in Exeter
tender_description:
The Authority owns a waste transfer facility in Exeter (the Facility) which offers an approximate working floor area of 840 m2, surrounded on 3 sides by 5-metre-high, reinforced concrete push walls. The Authority will lease the Facility to the incoming service provider on a peppercorn rent basis, from which point the service provider will undertake the Authority's service requirements explained in the specification.

The primary service requirement of the Authority is for the waste transfer facility to receive waste diverted away from its energy recovery facility which is located adjacent to the waste transfer facility during its planned or unplanned downtimes which is anticipated to be around 40 days a year. However, the energy recovery facility's downtimes can be less or significantly longer than 40 days in the future. Tonnage data has been provided as part of the tender pack to give tenderers an indication of the facility's downtimes in the past 3 years.
However, there are a number of function in addition to the above requirement that the waste transfer facility's operator will be expected to undertake which are detailed in the specification.
The contract for this service provision will be for an initial period of 5 years with an estimated annual value of 140 000 GBP with provision to extend the contract for a further 4 years, subject to the parties' mutual agreement.

tender_title: The Service provision of The Café, hire and events catering at Mansfield Central Library
tender_description:
Nottinghamshire County Council (the Council) on behalf of Culture, Learning and Libraries (Midlands), trading as Inspire invites tenders from suitably qualified and experienced catering companies or individuals for the opportunity to operate a café within Mansfield Central Library. 
The aim is to put in place a concession agreement with a single Concessionaire to operate a café and provide events/hire catering within Mansfield Central Library. T
he concession agreement has a minimal fixed payment as a contribution to the running costs of the space and a concession based on gross turnover (3% of all gross turnover). 
A charge free period would be available whilst the café is getting up and running. 
The concession agreement would run to March 2026.
Inspire is seeking the right provision to be in place as soon as possible with a mutually agreed start date between Inspire and the Concessionaire.
Please read all the tender documents.  If you have any questions, please submit them through the procurement portal using the messaging facility. The deadline for questions prior to tender submission is the 24th November 2021, this is to allow time for questions to be answered before the deadline.  
We also welcome visits to Mansfield Central Library to view the area where the café will be located. These visits need to be booked in advance and can take place from the 8th November to the 19th November 2021.  Please request any visits through the procurement portal using the messaging facility.
Please complete Part Four - Selection Questionnaire.  All questions must be answered online on the portal.
Please complete Part Five - Providers Response.  This is a word document which is to be downloaded, all questions answered and then you must upload your response back onto the portal for submission.
Please complete the Cashflow forecast excel spreadsheet.  This excel spreadsheet should be downloaded, completed, and then uploaded back onto the portal for submission.

tender_description: Lancashire County Council is seeking tenders for the provision of Services for the Acceptance and Composting of un-shredded Green Waste. The requirement is separated into 13 Lots which are aligned to the districts of Lancashire and Blackpool Council.

tender_title: Materials Marketing Contract
tender_description: ECC is seeking to award a contract for the provision of materials marketing services. The successful contractor will be required to broker waste collected from across the Authorities network of recycling centres and other collection points. The contractor will be required to deliver the most economical outcome for treatment and disposal of material.

tender_title: Bulk Waste Haulage Services Contract
tender_description:
Essex County Council is the Waste Disposal Authority for Essex and is responsible for the disposal of circa 700,000 tonnes of varying household waste per annum. This contract has been procured using an open procedure to  ensure that waste is transported to various treatment and disposal points in the most cost-efficient manner.

The successful contractor will be responsible for ensuring that sufficient waste is removed from the Authority's network of 5 transfer stations on a daily basis so that stock levels remain within operational and permitted levels. The contractor will provide sufficient equipment to meet the Authority's requirements and may provide equipment on a rental basis as required. The contractor may also be required to transport waste from other collection points as required.

The contract is for a duration of 4 years with the option to extend the term for up to a further 4 years if agreed by the Authority and otherwise provided for in the contract.

Delivery points will include a range of treatment or disposal facilities including landfill sites. Waste types transported may include all types of local authority collected wastes including biowastes.

tender_title: Bio-waste Treatment, Transfer and Transport Services Framework
tender_description: Essex County Council (ECC) and Southend-on-Sea Borough Council (Southend) are seeking to procure Bio-waste Treatment, Transfer and Transport Services via a Framework for the county of Essex and the unitary authority of Southend-on-Sea. Providers will be appointed to the Framework for various lots as described in the Services Specification set out in the Framework Agreement, namely:1. Green Waste Only 2. Food Waste Only; 3. Mixed Green and Food Waste and 4. Transfer and Transport (Haulage). The Framework will appoint Providers on a site neutral basis and ECC will at its discretion allow only existing Framework Providers to add new disposal point(s) subject to Providers complying with the conditions of award set out in Part B of the Invitation to Tender relating to this Framework and any requirements defined under a Mini Competition. There will be no guarantee of any Service Orders under this Framework.

tender_title: TD1685 - Organic Waste Processing
tender_description:
Derby City Council ('the Council') requires a service provider to provide Organic Waste Bulking, Waste Transfer, Haulage and Processing Services from 9th of June 2021. The Council is responsible for waste services for c.257,000 residents living in c.111,000 households. The Council provides a service to residents which includes the fortnightly collection of organic wastes (comingled garden waste and food waste) from 240l wheeled bins. It is anticipated that the Council will collect approximately 16 ktpa of Organic Waste at Service Commencement. The Council anticipates that this volume will increase over the Term, and could increase to c.22 ktpa. The organic waste will be tipped at a waste transfer station within the City and Bulked (Lot 1) and will then be hauled and delivered to a nominated delivery point, via bulk haulage vehicles for processing and then processed (Lot 2).

The Service Period will commence on 9th June 2021 and will end on 8th June 2024. Further, there will be an option to extend the Service Period. There will be two extensions possible, each of up to one (1) year in duration.

Please note, suppliers wishing to express interest and obtain the documentation, must do so by 15:00 on 5th April 2021. It is recommended that you express interest and obtain the documentation well before this time to allow sufficient time to prepare and submit a comprehensive response. The deadline for returns is 14:00 on 6th April 2021. 

Please visit the Council's e-tendering system  https://www.eastmidstenders.org where you can express interest and obtain the documents, (please note we will only accept expressions of interest through the e-tendering system. Please search for TD1685

To register an interest, access to further documents and information and respond to this tender opportunity, please visit: https://procontract.due-north.com/Advert/Index?advertId=04a78974-817a-eb11-810a-005056b64545

tender_title: TENDER FOR A JOINT WASTE COLLECTION CONTRACT FOR HART DISTRICT COUNCIL AND BASINGSTOKE AND DEANE BOROUGH COUNCIL 2018-2026
tender_description:
Basingstoke and Deane Borough Council (BDBC) and Hart District Council (HDC) (together 'the authority') currently operate a joint contract for their household waste and recycling collection services, which is due to expire in October 2018.

BDBC and HDC have agreed to continue with their joint contract arrangements and, in carrying out this re-tender process, they are seeking to realise further efficiencies. However, it is recognised that they currently have different collection regimes for residual household waste (HDC collecting alternate weekly and BDBC collecting weekly) and therefore, in order to identify potential savings and service efficiencies, the authority is (subject to BDBC Cabinet approval in March 2017) also seeking a separate price for operating a contract under which BDBC and HDC both provide alternate weekly collections for residual waste and dry recycling.

The authority is also seeking Potential suppliers views on introducing a range of other optional services, including a kerbside textile collection using plastic sacks which would be placed out with either the refuse or recycling containers.

The service is managed by HDC on behalf of both BDBC and HDC under an inter-authority agreement and a single Client team, thereby ensuring efficiencies and clarity of accountability for the contractor.  
The contract is also supported by one Contact Centre, but this could change in the future so contractors need to be aware that they could be working with two centres with differing IT systems.

Basingstoke and Deane Borough Council- Situated in north Hampshire, Basingstoke & Deane has a population of 160,100 consisting of approximately 70,200 households.  Whilst most residents live within the town of Basingstoke, the majority of the borough is rural, covering 245 square miles in total.

Hart District Council- Situated in north Hampshire, Hart is a mainly rural area covering  of 83 square miles, with a population of 89,000 consisting of 36,478 households.  The district has one main town, Fleet, but has rural village settlements of Yateley, Blackwater, Odiham, Hook and Hartley Wintney.

Use of Electronic Tendering Tool: The authority is utilising an electronic tendering tool to manage this procurement and communicate with Potential suppliers. Accordingly, there will be no hard copy documents issued to Potential supplier and all communications with the authority, including submission of the Selection Questionnaire response, will be conducted via the ProContract system, which can be accessed using the following link: https://sebp.due-north.com/
This procurement is being carried out under the competitive procedure with negotiation, where the call for completion was made in the Prior Information Notice published on [date TBC] 2017, Ref No: TBC. Potential suppliers are requested to submit their expression of interest by 12:00:00 on Monday 20th February 2017.

tender_title: CWC20013 - Waste Disposal Management - Kerbside Clinical
tender_description:
The Council requires a Provider to provide a disposal service for clinical waste collected by the Council from across the City.
The Council shall deliver the clinical waste to the Provider's designated Site(s). The Provider shall receive the Wastes at the Provider's Site(s) in accordance with the conditions of the site.
classification_description: Sewage, refuse, cleaning and environmental services

tender_title: CWC20024 - Disposal of Disused Plastic Wheelie Bins
tender_description: The Council is seeking a Contractor(s) to collect and manage all onward processes in the recycling or reprocessing of disused redundant and damaged plastic wheelie bins of various sizes (typically but not exclusively 140l, 240l and 360l) from the council's stock of bins in Wolverhampton. This plastic waste is expected to be collected as a commodity with an income value to be received by the Council.

Waste associated with this contract is expected to be collected from the Council as a free of charge service.

tender_title: SC20048 - Paper and Card Processing Services
tender_description:
Kent County Council ("KCC") requires a concessions service contract(s) for the processing of mixed paper and card arising from all household waste in Kent for five years from 1 December 2021. Through its contracts with third-party waste transfer providers, KCC will deliver this material to the concessionaire's waste processing facility (or waste transfer station as appropriate). \r
\r
The concessionaire must have the capability and capacity to receive and process the following volumes of waste material:\r
 â€¢ Lot A (West Kent) - at least 15,000 tonnes per annum;\r
 â€¢ Lot B (East Kent) - at least 20,000 tonnes per annum; and\r
 â€¢ Lot C (All Kent, i.e. Lot A + Lot B) - at least 35,000 tonnes per annum. \r
\r
The concessionaire will also be required to have in place:\r
 â€¢ a waste processing facility with appropriate permitting and planning permissions;\r
 â€¢ an electronic weighbridge for the weighing-in of material delivered to their facility to provide KCC with the appropriate management information (including weigh-loader transaction listings);\r
 â€¢ policies and procedures that recovers materials in accordance with the waste hierarchy to maximise reuse and recycling and to avoid sending any waste to landfill; and\r
 â€¢ robust service contingency plans to ensure continuity of services in the event of plant failure, etc. \r
\r
Please 'Register an Interest' in this opportunity via the Kent Business Portal to gain automatic access to the Invitation to Tender documentation and further details on KCC's requirements.

tender_title: Morningthorpe landfill site power generation - AWARD

tender_title: Catering Concession at Hamworthy Park
tender_description:
BCP Council is seeking an experienced café/restaurant Operator for the catering concession at Hamworthy Park, Hamworthy. The Council is looking for a Bidder who is already running a café/restaurant or a Bidder who has operated one in the past. The Council is seeking prospective Operators who wish to support visitor needs by providing them with a quality catering and refreshment offer, from the existing café building. 

The successful Operator is required to manage and carry out all operational aspects of the café including, but not limited to, staff welfare, employment legislation, training, certification and illness. 

Owned by BCP Council, the café building is single storey and has been recently decorated both internally and externally. One part of it comprises of the public conveniences, and the other part is the cafe area. The café has limited storage internally. Additional storage has been available from a container situated at the rear of the building. This will require planning permission, if required, and will be subject to planning approvals which will be for the Operator to obtain. 

The location of the concession is Hamworthy Park, Lulworth Avenue, Poole BH15 4DH. 

The anticipated start date of the contract would be 1 March 2022. The contract will be for an initial 5-year lease until 28 February 2027 with an option to extend for an additional 2 years up to 28 February 2029 if both parties are in agreement.

There is currently an catering operation at the site. It is the responsibility of Bidders to consider the effect and applicability of the Transfer of Undertakings - Protection of Employment (TUPE) to the facts and circumstances of this procurement and to act accordingly.  Unless this procurement affects employees of the Council, the Council will not give any opinion on the applicability or effect of TUPE and you should take your own legal and any other professional advice to satisfy yourselves regarding the likelihood of TUPE applying to any employee as defined by TUPE and in no circumstances shall the Council incur any liability in relation to any TUPE issues except as required by law

As part of the Bid, organisations will need to confirm how much they are offering the council for the concession.

tender_title: Combined Heat and Power Unit at Meadowside Leisure Centre
tender_description:
East Staffordshire Borough Council is seeking suitably qualified Applicants to bid for the provision of a combined heat and power unit (“CHP Unit”) to provide electricity and heat for the Meadowside Leisure Centre.

The CHP Unit is to be installed and operated at no capital cost to the Council under a discount energy purchasing agreement (“DEP”) for a period of ten years. Under the DEP, the Council will agree to purchase the electricity produced by the CHP Unit at an agreed rate for a period of ten years and pay for the gas consumed by the CHP Unit. Any heat generated by the CHP Unit will be supplied to the Council for use on the site free of charge.
classification_description: Electricity, heating, solar and nuclear energy

tender_title: CP1236-15 Contract for the processing of Food Waste
tender_description:
The District Councils of West Devon, and Teignbridge are expected to collect an estimated 7000 tonnes per annum of Food & kitchen waste which requires processing to PAS 110 standards or equivalent from April 2017. South Hams District Council is also expected to collect an estimated  further 3800 tonnes of Food waste separately from April 2018. 
The District Councils of Mid Devon, East Devon are expected to collect an estimated 9000 tonnes per annum of Food & kitchen waste which requires processing to PAS 110 standards or equivalent from April 2017. Exeter City Council is also expected to collect an estimated  further 4700 tonnes of Food waste separately from April 2018. 
This tendering opportunity is for the processing of the above separately collected Food Waste.   
The above requirements are offered in two Service Lot contracts; one for the waste from the east region of Devon and another from the west of Areas of Devon. 
The contracts will be for an initial duration of 10 years with option to extend for a further period of 4 years.
classification_description: Sewage, refuse, cleaning and environmental services

tender_description:
The Contract is for the provision of waste reception points by the contractor to which the District Councils of East Devon, North Devon and Torridge can deliver their separately collected garden waste. The contractor shall then compost the delivered waste either at the same locations or haul the waste to their waste compostingfacility for composting.
The service under this contract is not divided into lots as the Authority considers that this may result in a gap inthe provision of the Service.
The Service for composting East Devon's garden waste is required to start from 14th May 2019, while therequirement for the Service start for North Devon & Torridge is 14th October 2019. The Service for all District Councils shall continue until 31st March 2027, with option to extend the contract for periods totalling a maximumof 4 further years beyond 31st March 2027.

tender_title: CONTRACT FOR THE PROVISION OF A FULLY MANAGED SERVICE FOR ENERGY SUPPLY (GAS AND ELECTRIC)
tender_description: The Council is seeking to make provision for its gas and electricity requirements from 1st April 2022 for a period of five years. The Council intends to procure a fully managed service whereby the Managed Service Provider (MSP) will purchase energy for and on behalf of the Council via a framework compliant with the Public Contract Regulations, which amounts to approximately £6,000,000 per annum within its Corporate, Streetlighting and Schools portfolio including Academies. It will provide a flexible purchasing method of procuring energy and will provide an end to end billing and management service. It will take the form of a single contract with the MSP negating the need to have a separate contract with the energy supplier. All correspondence and submissions should be received via www.the-chest.org.uk project ID DN519601
classification_description: Petroleum products, fuel, electricity and other sources of energy

tender_title: Contract for the Provision and Operation of a Material Recovery Facility and Delivery Points
tender_description:
Gateshead Council, South Tyneside Council and Sunderland City Council have formed The South Tyne and Wear Waste Management Partnership to implement their waste management responsibilities jointly and are represented by Gateshead Council as the lead Authority. 
Gateshead Council on behalf of Gateshead Council, South Tyneside Council and Sunderland Councils for the Provision and Operation of a Materials Recovery Facility/ies to include haulage and processing of Authorised Materials and Delivery Points.

The requirements of the contract are:-

Lot 1 - Gateshead

•	The provision of a Materials Recovery Facility (MRF) to process and sort collected Materials.
•	The provision of a suitable supporting Delivery Point(s) which will receive the Authorised Materials delivered by Gateshead Council and from which the Contractor will transfer the delivered Authorised Materials to the appropriate Processing Facility
•	The transfer of the segregated Materials to suitable merchants or re-processors.
•	The provision of a complete record of all Materials delivered, the interim processors/Outlets and the ultimate destination of each Material
•	Monthly analysis of the Materials carried out in accordance with the MRF Code of Practice.

Lot 2 - Sunderland

•	The provision of a Materials Recovery Facility (MRF) to process and sort collected Materials.
•	The provision of a suitable supporting Delivery Point(s) which will receive the Authorised Materials delivered by Sunderland Council and from which the Contractor will transfer the delivered Authorised Materials to the appropriate Processing Facility
•	The transfer of the segregated Materials to suitable merchants or re-processors.
•	The provision of a complete record of all Materials delivered, the interim processors/Outlets and the ultimate destination of each Material
•	Monthly analysis of the Materials carried out in accordance with the MRF Code of Practice.

Lot 3 - South Tyneside Council

•	The provision of a Materials Recovery Facility (MRF) to process and sort collected Materials.
•	South Tyneside will provide its own Recycling Transfer Station (delivery point) from which the Contractor will transfer the delivered Authorised Material to the appropriate processing Facility. (See further details in the introduction.)
•	The transfer of the segregated Materials to suitable merchants or re-processors.
•	The provision of a complete record of all Materials delivered, the interim processors/Outlets and the ultimate destination of each Material
•	Monthly analysis of the Materials carried out in accordance with the MRF Code of Practice.

Tenderers may bid for one or all Lots.

To apply for this opportunity please visit https://procontract.due-north.com/Home/About
classification_description: Sewage, refuse, cleaning and environmental services

tender_title: CBC-1127-T-CE Residual Waste Disposal Tender CBC and BBC - AWARD
tender_description:
Joint Tender exercise between Central Bedfordshire Council and Bedford Borough Council for residual waste treatment; kerbside collected black bag waste and bulky waste. Provision for treatment of HWRC collected bulky waste and black bag waste.
      
      You are invited to tender for the Lots detailed below:
      
      1. Lot 1 - Bedford Borough Council - Household/Commercial Kerbside Residual Collections/Black Bag Waste and Bulky Waste
      2. Lot 2 - Central Bedfordshire Council - Household Kerbside and Street Cleansing Residual Waste South
      3. Lot 3 - Central Bedfordshire Council - Household Kerbside and Street Cleansing Residual Waste - North
      4. Lot 4 - Central Bedfordshire Council - Household Kerbside and Street Cleansing Residual Waste - South
      5. Lot 5 - Central Bedfordshire Council - Bulky Waste - North
      6. Lot 6 - Central Bedfordshire Council - Bulky Waste - South 
      
      Tenderers may bid for all Lots, any combination of Lots of just one Lot. 
      
      Please note, a separate contract will be held for each Lot and the Contract will be between the single Council responsible for that lot and the Contractor. 
      
      Notification of intention to award 21/08/2020 to 6/10/2020
      Award of Contract 01/09/2020 to 19/10/2020
      Target contract commencement date or delivery date 01/10/2020 to 14/11/2020
      
      Please note, Bedford Borough Council will need to seek approval from its Executive Committee prior to awarding Lot 1. This is why the notification of intention to award, mobilisation and award of contract dates vary. 
      
      Lots 2 - 6 offered by Central Bedfordshire Council have varying start dates which are detailed in Schedule 2 (Specification)
      
      Tender process: OJEU - Open
      
      Help and Support - The Council will provide as much support and information as it can to help guide you through the Tender process.  Questions asked together with the response, will be made available to all tenderers to ensure a fair and consistent approach to all. If there is anything you are not sure of or need clarification on, please send a correspondence using the 'In-Tend' Portal tendering system.
      
      Last date for receiving questions on In-Tend system: 31/07/2020
      
      Return of Tender - Completed Tenders and attachments should be submitted electronically, by the due date via our In-Tend electronic tendering system. Tenders must be uploaded via the My Return section of the system. Tenders submitted through the correspondence facility will not be considered.  Your Tender must be submitted via the In-Tend system by no later than 12:00 noon on 10/08/2020. Tenders received after that time will be excluded.
