tender_title: CBC-1127-T-CE Residual Waste Disposal Tender CBC and BBC - AWARD
tender_description:
Joint Tender exercise between Central Bedfordshire Council and Bedford Borough Council for residual waste treatment; kerbside collected black bag waste and bulky waste. Provision for treatment of HWRC collected bulky waste and black bag waste.
      
      You are invited to tender for the Lots detailed below:
      
      1. Lot 1 - Bedford Borough Council - Household/Commercial Kerbside Residual Collections/Black Bag Waste and Bulky Waste
      2. Lot 2 - Central Bedfordshire Council - Household Kerbside and Street Cleansing Residual Waste South
      3. Lot 3 - Central Bedfordshire Council - Household Kerbside and Street Cleansing Residual Waste - North
      4. Lot 4 - Central Bedfordshire Council - Household Kerbside and Street Cleansing Residual Waste - South
      5. Lot 5 - Central Bedfordshire Council - Bulky Waste - North
      6. Lot 6 - Central Bedfordshire Council - Bulky Waste - South 
      
      Tenderers may bid for all Lots, any combination of Lots of just one Lot. 
      
      Please note, a separate contract will be held for each Lot and the Contract will be between the single Council responsible for that lot and the Contractor. 
      
      Notification of intention to award 21/08/2020 to 6/10/2020
      Award of Contract 01/09/2020 to 19/10/2020
      Target contract commencement date or delivery date 01/10/2020 to 14/11/2020
      
      Please note, Bedford Borough Council will need to seek approval from its Executive Committee prior to awarding Lot 1. This is why the notification of intention to award, mobilisation and award of contract dates vary. 
      
      Lots 2 - 6 offered by Central Bedfordshire Council have varying start dates which are detailed in Schedule 2 (Specification)
      
      Tender process: OJEU - Open
      
      Help and Support - The Council will provide as much support and information as it can to help guide you through the Tender process.  Questions asked together with the response, will be made available to all tenderers to ensure a fair and consistent approach to all. If there is anything you are not sure of or need clarification on, please send a correspondence using the 'In-Tend' Portal tendering system.
      
      Last date for receiving questions on In-Tend system: 31/07/2020
      
      Return of Tender - Completed Tenders and attachments should be submitted electronically, by the due date via our In-Tend electronic tendering system. Tenders must be uploaded via the My Return section of the system. Tenders submitted through the correspondence facility will not be considered.  Your Tender must be submitted via the In-Tend system by no later than 12:00 noon on 10/08/2020. Tenders received after that time will be excluded.
classification_description: Non-hazardous refuse and waste treatment and disposal services

tender_title: Management and Operation of Household Waste Recycling Centres ( Community Recycling Centres )
tender_description:
Warrington Borough Council (WBC) has a statutory duty to provide household waste recycling facilities (from now on referred to as "Community Recycling Centres") for its residents to dispose of their household waste which is unable to be collected as part of the fortnightly kerbside collection schemes.
The primary purpose of a CRC is to provide facilities where residents can deposit waste materials for recovery by re-use, recycling or composting. The secondary purpose of a CRC is to provide facilities where residents can deposit waste materials for their subsequent disposal.

The service requirement is as follows:
Management and operations of CRC Sites - including staffing, all equipment, waste segregation, facilities management, asset management, maximising recycling and diversion from disposal operations.

Haulage of Waste to final disposal/treatment outlets - each individual waste stream will need to be transported to a waste treatment/recovery facility as determined by the contractor.  The Council will consider the option of providing the treatment/recovery of residual and organic waste streams as part of the Councils Residual and Organic Waste contracts.

Recovery/Treatment/Disposal of waste streams collected at the CRC sites - each individual waste stream collected at the CRCs will need to be consigned to a recovery, treatment or where required disposal facility.

tender_title: CBC-0952-T-CE Waste Collection Services - AWARD
tender_description:
Central Bedfordshire Council (CBC) seeks a suitably experienced and accredited Services Provider to provide a comprehensive high-quality range of waste and recycling collection, street and public open space cleansing across the whole of the authority area. 
      
      The contract will cover the collection of dry recyclable, residual, garden and food waste from households and the provision of services including bulky waste and clinical collection.  The cleansing of streets and public open spaces and the associated services.
      
      Tender process/procedure: OJEU, Restricted two stage - PART A (SSQ) and PART B (ITT).
      
      Standard Selection Questionnaire 
      Part A - Standard Selection Questionnaire (SSQ) is a mandatory questionnaire document which must be completed. 
      
      Your tender will be rejected if this questionnaire is not completed as part of your tender submission as your organisation is assessed on the selection criteria contained in Part A.
      
      Shortlisting of tenders will take place and will be made up of those Bidders who score the most points against this SSQ, are ranked the highest and thereby become one of a minimum of the top 5, however we may add more Bidders to the shortlist at the Council's discretion.
      
      Those Bidders shortlisted under Part A (SSQ) will be invited to complete Part B (ITT), the Quality Questionnaire and Pricing Schedule.
      
      Tender Timescales: 
      Submission of SQQ (Part A): 12 Noon, 17th December 2018
      Successful Bidders invited to complete the Tender (Part B):14th January 2019
      Deadline for receipt of Tenders: See return of tender section 5th April 2019
      
      Help and Support - The Council will provide as much support and information as it can to help guide you through the Tender process.  Questions asked together with the response will be made available to all tenderers to ensure a fair and consistent approach to all. All responses and updates will be issued as a 'Clarification' via the In-Tend portal.
      
      If there is anything you are not sure of or need clarification on, please contact us using the 'Correspondence' facility within the In-tend electronic tendering system.

tender_title: SC19002 - Waste Transfer Services (Dover)
tender_description:
AWARD for Waste transfer services which include the following services: (a) the reception of waste (i.e. allowing the off-loading of waste by Refuse Collection Vehicles and other waste collection vehicles); and (b) the haulage of waste to waste processing/disposal sites.
The requirements include the following: (a)Waste transfer sites must have all the valid and appropriate planning permission, environmental and other relevant permits including the relevant technical competencies for the type and amount of waste to be handled under this Contract and otherwise all permissions and certification required to deliver the required services; (b) Vehicle drivers will need to be suitably qualified and carry-out their duties to British and European (or equivalent) Community transport legislation; (c) The Provider will need to be a registered carrier of waste as per SI No. 1624 (1991) Environmental Protection: The Controlled Waste (Registration of Carriers and Seizure of Vehicles) Regulations 1991 or any successor legislation; (d) Drivers and plant operators (including temporary/agency staff) will need to be in possession of a relevant Certificate of Training awarded by the Construction Industry Training Board or other similar/equivalent approved training scheme for the operation of all service vehicles and plant and/or equipment used to deliver the required Services; (e) Vehicle operators will need to have a full and valid Goods Vehicle Operator Licence and also a full and valid Controlled Waste (Registration of Carriers and Seizure of Vehicles) Regulations 1991 Certificate; (f) Waste transfer sites must be open to receive waste Monday - Saturday, including Public and Bank Holidays in England & Wales (the only exception being Christmas Day & Boxing Day unless otherwise agreed by KCC); (g) Waste transfer sites must be able to receive the following types of waste from the service commencement date: (i) Residual Waste; (ii) Bulky Waste (including occasional fly tipping); (iii) Highways Mechanical Sweepings (HMA); and (iv) Street Litter Arisings (including occasional beach arisings); and (h) Waste transfer sites must be able to receive the following types of waste from 16 January 2021: (i) Food Waste; (ii) Paper & Card; and (iii) Dry Mixed Recyclables (i.e. co-mingle of glass, cans, and plastics). KCC will also reserve the right to modify the contract to include the transfer of Green Waste if required.

tender_title: Contract for the Monitoring & Maintenance Proposal, Mildenhall Hub
tender_description: The purpose of the contract is to provide monitoring and maintenance services for the BESS at Mildenhall hub ensuring that its operation sites within standard operating permitters, to ensure the unit warranty is upheld.

tender_title: Cafe Operator for a Cafe in Victoria Park, Stafford
tender_description:
An exciting and unique opportunity has arisen within the County town. A brand new café is being built in Victoria Park in Stafford; it will adjoin the bowls green and capture riverside views in the beautiful surroundings of the park. Stafford Borough Council have developed in with The Environment Partnership (TEP) as part of the National Heritage Lottery funded project, a fully designed café for approximately 32 indoor covers and 48 outdoor covers, dependent on configuration.

Much careful thought is being placed on the design and aesthetic of the new café to make it appealing to the wide variety of audiences who visit the park. The annual footfall into Victoria Park is 600,000 with a view to increasing this as part of the National Heritage Lottery funds activity plan.

It is anticipated that the redeveloped Park Cafe will be opening in summer 2020, with the kitchen and café fit out from spring 2020 onwards.

tender_title: Waste and Recycling Collection Service and Processing of Dry Recycling (Stafford Borough Council)
tender_description:
Stafford Borough is a mixed urban and rural district covering an area of 597km² in the centre of the county of Staffordshire. It has a population of approximately 130,000 and there are approximately 57,290 households, with 2 main towns: the county town of Stafford and the town of Stone; along with a number of villages of various sizes.

The current waste and recycling collection service contract is due to expire on 3rd February 2018 and the Council requires a new contract for services beyond that date.  The Council also recognises that the world of municipal collection and processing contracts is changing.  There are continual demands for efficiency savings, shared services and harmonisation of methodologies.  With this in mind, the Council proposes to enter into a Framework Agreement for these services with the successful tenderer.

The framework agreement duration will be  6 years.  

Stafford Borough Council will call off its own contract for the period 4th February 2018 to 31st March 2028 with an option to extend for a further 10 years, i.e. to 31st March 2038.

Provision for the Control of Legionella in Schools and Public
Buildings

tender_title: Catering and Associated Cleaning Services within Barrow Borough Council
tender_description:
Barrow-in-Furness Borough Council are seeking Contractors to provide Catering and associated Cleaning Services for two of their high profile venues in Barrow.

The Forum, theatre and arts centre is situated in the centre of Barrow, offering a varying programme with around 65,000 tickets sold per year and a healthy and dedicated conference and banqueting business, attracting c500 conferences per year. Catering consists of a public cafe, a bar-restaurant, pop up bars and the conference and banqueting functions.

The Dock Museum is a free entry museum attracting c60,500 visitors and with a public cafe located at the entrance to the museum and near the outdoor play area, which is regularly used by locals.

The 5 year contract covers the exclusive rights for all catering at both venues, plus associated cleaning services and there will be an option to extend a further 3 years, subject to satisfactory performance. The form of contract will be the Council's Standard Service Contract, along with a Service Level Agreement (SLA) setting out more operational detail and specifications, both included in the tender pack provided. The Council requires the successful Contractor to provide both catering and cleaning services at both venues, as per the specifications, with each service attracting a separate financial agreement. The Council's financial expectations are detailed in full in the Specification and the Pricing Schedule.

The Council is seeking applications from suitability qualified and experienced contractors able to provide evidence of the operation and management of similar contracts. The Council will be looking for a Contractor to operate these services who will share the Council's vision for the future of the venues as well as the overall ethos and business approach. The venues are high profile in the area and, as such need to retain their high standards and excellent reputation, of which the catering and cleaning are obviously integral elements.

tender_title: Northampton Borough Council - Environmental Services
tender_description:
The Contracting Authority intends to deliver the following outcomes from the contract:
- A clean and attractive town for residents and visitors
- Enhanced local participation and pride
- Quality modern and well-managed services
- An economic, efficient and effective Council

It is anticipated that the Contract will cover a wide range of services 
Consideration may be given during the procurement and negotiation process to the omission of some of the Services: Household Waste Collection Services; Materials management;
Street Cleansing Services; Grounds Maintenance Services; Parks Services; Allotments Services; Cemeteries Services; Trees Inspection and Maintenance Services; Public Conveniences Services; Customer Management of Contracted Services; Communications and Education. The Services may contain some minor elements of works.

tender_title: DDP013 Provision of Waste and Recycling Services for Derbyshire Dales
tender_description:
Derbyshire Dales District Council is seeking to procure a Waste and Recycling Services Contract from 2 August 2020 for an initial term of 8 years, with an option to extend for a further 8 year period. 

The Council is a Waste Collection Authority in Derbyshire with 34154 households (March 2019). The Derbyshire Dales District covers approximately 800sq. kms of which approximately 84% of the area is rural, and has a population of around 70,700 people. The district has five towns and over 100 villages with almost half of the population of the district living in outlying villages and the remainder residing in the five towns. 

The Contract shall include the following Services. 

Waste Collection Services: 
Household Residual Waste collection 
Household Dry Recycling collection 
Household Food Waste collection 
Household Garden Waste collection 
Christmas Tree Recycling collection 
Household Bulky Waste and White Goods collection Commercial Waste & Recycling collection 
Clinical Waste Collection 

Processing of dry recycling: 
Marketing the separately collected paper stream 
Haulage of Dry Recycling to the reprocessor(s) 
Handling marketing and haulage of the Recyclable Materials to separate into saleable products that maximise the value of the material

tender_title: TC045 Catering and Bar Services Concession Agreement Relating to Services at Albert Halls
tender_description:
The Borough Council of Bolton ("the Authority") is prepared to receive tenders for Catering and Bar Services Relating to Services at Albert Halls, Bolton which will be subject to the information, specification and tender package enclosed.
This procurement exercise is being run as an Open Invitation to Tender (ITT) via the Concession Contracts Regulations 2016 and the Authority will appoint a single contractor on the Concession Agreement.
The Authority expects to contract with an experienced Restaurant, Bar and Event Catering Provider (the "Provider"), who will 'fit out', develop and utilise the Restaurant/Café area as a 'public catering venue', including its use to support, optimise and deliver efficiency in the other Event Catering and Bar services provided under this Concession Agreement.

tender_title: Electric Charging Infrastructure
tender_description: Rotherham Metropolitan Borough Council (RMBC) has recently received grant funding to enable them to install a vehicle charging infrastructure across the Borough and therefore invites tenders in respect of a contract for the supply and installation of electric vehicle charge points (EVCPs).   All the products supplied must meet the Specification as described in the ESPO Framework Contract 636 - Electric Charging Infrastructure, Lot 1.

tender_title: Dover and Folkestone & Hythe District Councils Joint Waste Collection & Cleansing Contract
tender_description:
Dover and Folkestone & Hythe District Councils are seeking to appoint a contractor for the provision of waste collection, recycling and street cleansing services throughout the districts from January 2021 for an 8 year period.Expressions of interest will only be accepted via the Kent Business Portal www.kentbusinessportal.org.uk

Note that in order to successfully submit your interest you will first need to register for an account. After registration is complete and you've received your login details you should return to the advert for the opportunity and express your interest. You will then receive an email giving you a link to the Invitation to Participate in Dialogue (IPD) documentation (information only at this stage) and the Standard Selection Questionnaire (SSQ). The completed Standard Selection Questionnaire (SSQ) is to submitted electronically via the Kent Business Portal by no later than 17.00 hrs on the 30th October 2019.

tender_title: Concession Contract:  P3363 Provision of Hospitality, Catering and Events at the Pavilion Gardens Buxton
tender_description:
High Peak Borough Council wish to invite proposals from suitable operators in the Catering, Hospitality and Leisure industry to provide Hospitality, Catering and Events Services under the form of a Concession Contract for the Pavilion Gardens Visitor attraction situated in Buxton Derbyshire.

The Pavilion Gardens is an excellent historic venue situated in the heart of the spa town, providing a visitor attraction popular for catering and events to the local community, visitors and tourists to the town. The Council is looking to appoint a successfully established and experienced organisation to deliver and promote a high quality, value for money experience for visitors.

This exercise is being completed in accordance with the Concession Contract Regulations 2016 as advertised in the Official Journal of the European Union.
The intended start date for this contract is 1st January 2019.

This exercise is being managed through the Council's Electronic tendering system Proactis. To Register an Interest and submit a tender for this opportunity please visit the website below and select opportunities, Project reference number DN331466
https://supplystokeandstaffs.proactishosting.com/

You will need to register or log in (if you have already registered). The site is free to register and use and you will be given a secure login by the portal providers.

Requests to express an interest in this opportunity will be approved by the Council, prior to prospective participants accessing the full ITT (Invitation to Tender) Information.
If you have any queries or need assistance please contact us on procurement@highpeak.gov.uk or phone 0345 129 77 77

HPBC Reference: P3363
Closing date and time: Tuesday 4th September 2018 by 12:00 noon (please note that this has been extended from Friday 3rd August 2018 by 12:00 noon)
buyer_name: High Peak Borough Council & Staffordshire Moorlands District Council

tender_title: Waste and Recycling Collection, Street and Public Open Space Cleansing Services Contract
tender_description: Cornwall Council (the Authority) seeks a suitably experienced and accredited Services Provider to provide a comprehensive range of waste and recycling collection, street and public open space cleansing services across the whole of the County of Cornwall. The contract will cover the collection of dry recyclable, residual and biologically degradable waste from households and commercial properties, and the cleansing of streets and public open spaces, including beaches, as well as the service provision for the likes of Office Waste, Bulky Waste, Clinical Waste and other associated services. The Authority seeks to contract with a Services Provider that can actively manage materials used and discarded in Cornwall in a sustainable manner to improve the value of these services in Cornwall to all customers, and the cleanliness of the County. The Authority will require the successful Services Provider to implement a range of Social Value based initiatives to realize Socio-economic benefits.                              The current outsourced contract for 'Waste and Recycling Collection, Street and Beach Cleansing Services' will terminate on 31st March 2020, with the new contract anticipated to commence on 1st April 2020. It is envisaged this contract will have an initial term of eight (8) years with provision to extend by a further two (2) years, with the estimated term value of the Contract being approximately 20 000 000 GBP per annum.  The overall procurement process to be adopted will be the Competitive Dialogue process, consisting of an initial Pre-Qualification (PQQ) Stage (PQQ) stage to select Tenderers for ISDS (invitation to submit detailed solutions), followed by provisional ISRS (invitation to submit a refined solution) and ISFT (invitation to submit a final tender) stages, with no ISOS (invitation to submit outline solutions) stage. There will be down-selection at the PQQ stage and the ISDS stages and possibly at the provisional ISRS stage. The Services Provider will be selected from the ISFT stage. All ISDS, provisional ISRS and ISFT submissions will be evaluated and scores and constructive feedback will be provided to Tenderers at each stage. Dialogue will precede the provisional ISRS and ISFT stages. Of particular note, for waste collection, at the ISDS stage, the Authority requires the submission of detailed solutions for both of the following service provisions : 1. Mandatory solution: Weekly recycling and food waste collections with fortnightly residual waste collections (the Welsh waste collection model); or 2. Mandatory Variant solution: Weekly residual waste collections and fortnightly recycling collections (retaining the existing collection service). The Authority will evaluate both and anticipates making a decision during December, 2018, on its preferred solution to dialogue, based on affordability. Please refer to the ISDS Guidance Document for clarity over the use of the term 'Variant' in relation to this Procurement exercise.
classification_description: Sewage, refuse, cleaning and environmental services

tender_title: WDC - Street Cleansing and Grounds Maintenance Services
tender_description:
Following a Competitive Procedure with Negotiation process, the Council has seeked to award two Lots for Street Cleansing and Ground Maintenance provisions. The resulting contracts will be for an initial 8 year term following which, the Contract will include options for extending the provisions for up to further 96 months with a maximum contract duration of 16 years.

A previous Contracts Finder publication, advertising this procurement opportunity was originally published on the 28th November 2019 with the title 'WDC - Waste, street and grounds maintenance services for Warwick district'.

The Procurement followed the Competitive Procedure with Negotiation to source the most suitable solution for the Council.
Shortlisted bidders were invited to submit initial tenders. The Council reserved the right to award the contract on the basis of the initial tenders without conducting negotiations.  The Council reserved the right to run successive stages of negotiation and further shortlist participating bidder at each stage. The Council informed participating bidders when it wished to receive final offers.

The 'Estimated Lot value' provided in this notice is a potential total value for the entire 16 year term.  The Street Cleansing Lot estimated a total value of £45,000,000 and the Ground Maintenance Lot estimated a total value of £25,000,000

This is seen as a long term working arrangement to benefit all involved and the successful suppliers will be expected to work with the Council to ensure all requirements can be fulfilled in a combined and organised manner.

This procurement exercise was run electronically using the Council's e-tendering system (CSWJETS). Participants had to register and express an interest at https://intendhost.co.uk/ csw-jets/aspx/Home Once registered, correspondence for this procurement process was via the Correspondence function. All documentation and further information regarding the procurement was held on this system.

tender_title: Collection, Transfer, Treatment of Clinical Waste and Dead Animals, Leicestershire
tender_description:
Leicestershire County Council (The Council) is issuing this ITT to identify and appoint a suitable contractor for the Collection, Transfer and Treatment of Clinical Waste and Dead Animals (Waste).
Waste is collected by Waste Collection Authorities and delivered to a Council owned waste transfer station currently handling approximately 40 tonnes of Clinical waste and dead Animals per annum. It is anticipated the contract requirement shall be similar to that currently delivered however the Contract may include for waste arising from the following local authorities; Warwickshire County Council for approximately 90 tonnes per annum and Nottinghamshire County Council for approximately 70 tonnes per annum. Therefore the total contract value could vary from between 150,000 GBP to 1 400 000 GBP over the potential ten year period. Suppliers will be expected to provide containers at any waste transfer station, or similar facility where waste arising from the Council of waste collection Authorities is delivered to. The commencement date is 1.06.2019 with a minimum duration of 5 years but with a potential to extend to a maximum contract term of 10 years.

tender_title: Tender for Waste & Recycling Collection Services Contract
tender_description: The contract will deliver a waste and recycling collection service to around 50,500 households in Chorley Council's area with potential for another 1,120 properties in an adjacent Council's area. Residual waste, dry recycling (co-mingled plastic bottles, cans and glass) and garden waste will be collected on an alternate weekly basis with co-mingled paper and card collected every four weeks. The contract will also deliver a bulky waste collection service to households. The borough of Chorley is situated in central Lancashire and covers around 80 square miles. Chorley is well placed for access to the major cities of the North West and these good links makes it a popular place in live and invest in. This is reflected in its population, which is steadily expanding, its population was 107,200 in 2011.   The contract period is for 10 years plus 11 weeks (1 April 2019 until 15 June 2029) with the option to extend up to a further two years. The estimated contract value of £30,000,000 includes for the full potential contract period,including the period of optional extension and is based on current contract requirements.

tender_title: Food Waste Treatment Services
tender_description:
Gloucestershire County Council is seeking tenders for the provision and operation of a food waste (Contract Waste) treatment service. Bidders will be required to provide treatment of food waste and a  bulking and haulage service (if the treatment facility is located outside Gloucestershire.); the use of sub- contractors is acceptable for any part of the service.

Gloucestershire County Council may choose to direct WCAs to direct deliver food waste to the treatment or bulking point, or may make its own arrangements for local bulking and haulage to the treatment or bulking point from local WCAs depots if it is more economical to do so. This decision will be determined by factors of distance and cost. 

Current contract for the treatment of household food waste was let in 2014 and provides anaerobic digestion at a single site in the county. This contract expires in September 2021.

A single contract will be awarded for the treatment of all Food Waste collected and delivered from each District Council.  The contract will be for a period of eight (8) years with the option to extend for any period up to a further two (2) years.
 
The Contract Commencement date shall be 01 October 2021

tender_title: Provision of Waste Collection Services
tender_description:
Appointment of an operator to provide a three container kerbside collection service compromising; 

a)	Residual waste; 
b)	Organic (garden and food) waste;
c)	Dry recyclables. 

The objectives of the service are to:

•	provide high quality cost effective services that 
•	Maximises the amount of waste segregated for reuse; recycling and composting
•	Encourage high levels of recycling and waste minimisation 
•	Minimise contamination for all waste streams forming part of the contract
•	Creates no detrimental impact on the residents of the district by
	Adhering to collection , emptying and return of bin standards
	Minimising missed bins
	Preventing spillage and protection of the vicinity environment

tender_title: Residual waste haulage, treatment and disposal services
tender_description:
Residual waste haulage, treatment and disposal services

Swindon Borough Council invites tenders from suitably qualified and experienced service providers for the provision of services to haul, treat and dispose of local authority collected residual waste.

Swindon Borough Council is required to treat and dispose of around 55,000 tonnes of its own non-recyclable residual waste collected from the kerbside, and from its single household waste recycling centre.

Suppliers are invited to submit tenders for 10,000 tonne per annum lots, between 10,000 and the full 60,000 tonnes. The volume of the contracted waste will be variable over the term of the contract, with a guarantee of 70% of the full tonnage tendered for being given. The contract term will be for 8 years with no breaks or extensions being included.

The Council will provide and operate a Transfer Station facility within Swindon for the duration of the contract and load the waste onto the suppliers' trailers.

The annual value of the contract is expected to be in the region of £6-7.5m.    

Full details relating to the Services are provided in the tender documents.

To participate, Suppliers will need to Register as a Supplier with ProContract, www.supplyingthesouthwest.org.uk, then Register an Interest before obtaining access to the tender documents. In the event of difficulties registering as a supplier, please refer to the System Administrator Proactis support team ProContractSuppliers@proactis.com

The contract will be for a period of 96 months, expected to commence 4th April 2022. 

Tender Responses are required to be submitted no later than 28th September 2021, 14:00hrs UK Local time via ProContract tender portal - https://www.supplyingthesouthwest.org.uk/

If you require any clarifications on the tender documents, please submit these in writing via Messaging in ProContract tender portal by 14th September 2021, 12:00 hrs UK Local time. The Council's responses to these clarification questions will be uploaded periodically on the ProContract tender portal. 

Please note that this project has been advertised on Find a Tender Service (FTS)/Contracts Finder/ other web portals, however, Supplying the South West Portal, https://www.supplyingthesouthwest.org.uk/ is the only portal that includes all the relevant documents required to respond to this opportunity, bearing Project Id: DN559593

No Tender submissions will be considered without completing the tender documents in full including attachments and returning them in alignment with the instructions within the tender documents.

tender_title: Joint Waste, Recycling and Cleansing Contract
tender_description:
The Contracting Authority invites Expressions of Interest from suitably qualified and experienced organisations in relation to the Joint Waste, Recycling and Cleansing Contract. The Contracting Authority, Wycombe District Council, intends to jointly procure the Contract with Chiltern and South Bucks District Councils, collectively the "Authorities". The Authorities currently envisage utilising a single multi-party structure for the Contract.
      The Contracting Authority is conducting this procurement through the competitive dialogue procedure of the Public Contracts Regulations 2015. The Contract will be for an initial term of 10 years, with the potential to extend for period(s) up to a further 10 years (see II.2.4 for details). The duration of the extension(s) may be for any period up to 10 years, subject to not exceeding the maximum total contract term of 20 years. 
      The sum stated in II.1.7 below covers the full 20 year term and does not take account of indexation.
classification_description: Sewage, refuse, cleaning and environmental services

tender_title: Crawley Borough Council - District Heat Network: Operation, Maintenance, Metering and Billing Services - AWARD
tender_description:
Crawley Borough Council (CBC) is in the process of constructing a multi-phased town centre district heat network (DHN) which is being delivered via a phased approach over an estimated 5 year period. The first phase includes the design and build of the energy centre on the re-developed Town Hall site, along with the DHN which will service the re-developed Town Hall site, a combination of civic and commercial offices along with residential apartments located adjacent to the Town Hall and at the nearby Kilnmead Residential Development site. In all, Phase 1 will supply approximately 310 residential units and 10,887m2 of civic / commercial space. Following completion of Phase 1, the Council intends to construct the second phase of the DHN to serve the nearby Police station, residential development on Crawley College Car Park, Crawley College, Library and other connections around the town, encompassing at full potential build-out in excess of 60,000m2 commercial space and over 700 residential units.
      
      The design and installation of the DHN is being delivered by the CBC's development partner Westrock as part of the wider town centre development works. Following completion, CBC will adopt the DHN and take responsibility for the supply of heat to the various customers. CBC will be the heat supplier and, to deliver this function, CBC wishes to appoint a suitably qualified contractor to carry out the operation and maintenance of the DHN and provide metering and billing services to the end users. 
      
      The contractor will be required to:
      o carry out a full O&M service, including providing all services required to operate, maintain, test, inspect, repair and replace the relevant components of the DHN. 
      o undertake all scheduled and reactive repair works as part of the services. 
      o provide a full billing and metering service including: managing and collecting charges under the Council's Heat Supply Agreements with the end-users; processing and taking meter readings; and setting up and operating individual customer accounts.
      
      CBC is now inviting suitably qualified organisations to submit a response to the pre-qualification questionnaire (PQQ) for this contract opportunity. The Council proposes to award a single contract.
classification_description: Electricity, heating, solar and nuclear energy

tender_title: CP 1879-20 Contract for the haulage and Composting South Hams District Council's Garden Waste
tender_description:
South Hams District Council plan to roll out their seprate collection of garden waste from the Service Commencement Date identified in the tender documents and therefore the available tonnage records are limited. However, it is anticipated that, subject to seasonal changes, the District Council will collect around 4000 tonnes per annum of Garden Waste.
The successful Service provider will be required to collect South Hams District Council's garden waste from their waste transfer facility in Devon, and transport the collected garden waste to their composting point where the waste shall be composted to standards set by PAS 100.

tender_title: 15 106 Provision of an Organic Waste Treatment Solution
tender_description:
LOT 1 - Design, Build, Finance and Operate (DBFO) an Organic Waste Treatment Facility
Any applicant who intends to design, build, finance and operate (DBFO) an organic waste treatment facility.This includes any applicant who proposes to build a facility which is not solely for the processing of Cheshire East Council waste, and regardless of whether the facility will be located on Council provided land. This optionin cludes any applicant who may have already achieved in part, any aspects of the DBFO requirement, but do not yet have an operational facility commissioned.
LOT 2 - Existing Capacity at an Organic Waste Treatment Facility - Any applicant who intends to offer existing capacity (i.e. has been commissioned) at an organic waste treatment facility.                                                                                                            The contract will be for a period of 15 years with the potential to extend for up to 5 years (subject to the provisions of the contract and public procurement rules).
The values given in this notice are only estimations and cannot be exact given the fact that there is uncertainty regarding tonnage outturns.
The Authority gives no guarantee or warranty or makes any representation as to the accuracy of any indicative volumes or as to the value of the work during the contract period.
As set out in the Call for Final Tender (CFT), the basis of the award was the most economically advantageous tender (MEAT). The only submission for LOT 2 was non-compliant and resulted in the LOT 2 bid being rejected.The Council awarded the contract to the MEAT in LOT 1.

tender_title: Provision of a Combined Heat and Power (CHP) Unit for Medina Leisure Centre, Isle of Wight
tender_description:
The Isle of Wight Council ("the Authority") invites Tenders from suitably qualified suppliers ("Potential Suppliers") for the provision of a new combined heat and power (CHP) unit for Medina Leisure Centre and a subsequent service agreement.

This procurement follows the Open Procedure under the Public Contract Regulations 2015.

The contract will be in two phases: Phase one: for the decommissioning of the existing CHP unit, and the supply and installation of a new CHP unit, and Phase two: a maintenance contract for a period of up to 15 years.
The term of the contract shall be 29th October 2019 until 29th November 2019 for the decommissioning and supply and installation element;
thereafter the second element will be a fifteen-year maintenance agreement from 30th November 2019 up to 29th November 2034, but with 5 yearly break clauses in place. NOTE: that the contract has been listed as Services but is in fact a combination of Services and Works.
classification_description: Electricity, heating, solar and nuclear energy

tender_title: WSCC - DW -  Provision of West Sussex Electric Vehicle Chargepoint Network - AWARD
tender_description:
WSCC is seeking an organisation to plan a network and install Electric Vehicle ("EV") chargepoints, as well as manage and maintain the delivery of associated services of the network across the County of  West Sussex. 
      
      WSCC is looking for a service provider to work collaboratively alongside WSCC, District & Borough Councils and other community organisations, to deliver an affordable, widely accessible and recognisable chargepoint network across West Sussex. 
      
      The service provider will be responsible for planning, funding, building, marketing and operating the network, as well as providing an on-going 24/7 service (including the management of payments and support), maintenance and repair to ensure the network is fully operational at all times.
classification_description: Electricity, heating, solar and nuclear energy

tender_title: West of England Residual Municipal Waste Treatment Solutions
tender_description:
The West of England Waste Partnership, consisting of Bath & North East Somerset, Bristol City, North Somerset, and South Gloucestershire Councils, are seeking to procure arrangements for the treatment of their residual municipal solid waste. 

The main requirement is for the acceptance of waste for treatment from 1 April 2020 to 31 March 2030, with the option to extend by one or more periods to 31 March 2040. The awarded contract(s) will allow for the acceptance of some tonnages from 2019 pending available capacity of the successful contractor(s). 

The requirement is split into 2 lots 
Lot 1 -Residual Municipal Waste. Initial tonnages from April 2020 onwards are expected to be up to around 175k tonnes per year. Bidders must have a minimum annual capacity of at least 10,000 tonnes.  At least 90% of waste by tonnage must be diverted away from landfill
Lot 2- Bulky Waste. Initial tonnages from April 2020 onwards are expected to be in the region of 40k-50k tonnes per year. Bidders must have a minimum annual capacity of at least 2,000 tonnes. At least 80% of waste by tonnage must be diverted away from landfill
Bidders will be able to bid for some or all tonnages in either or both Lots. The Councils may award 1 or more contracts covering some or all tonnages available. 
Please see published documents for full requirements and details which can be accessed at https://www.supplyingthesouthwest.org.uk/
classification_description: Non-hazardous refuse and waste treatment and disposal services

tender_title: SC18072 - Food Waste Processing Services
tender_description: KCC requires the processing and disposal of food waste via anaerobic digestion.  The AD plant will need to have valid and appropriate planning permission, environmental and other relevant permits for quantity of food waste to be handled and otherwise all permissions and certification required to deliver the services for the duration of the Contract Period. The food waste collected by the Waste Collection Authorities in Kent will be transferred at and hauled from 7 different Waste Transfer Stations (WTSs) throughout Kent. The third-party waste transfer suppliers that provide waste transfer services in Kent on behalf of KCC will deliver food waste to the AD plant at KCC's own cost. This cost will be included when considering tenders for food waste processing services. KCC will provide a matrix to allow bidders to calculate the cost of haulage for inclusion.  It is anticipated that the AD plant will need to have the capacity and capability to handle up to 24 000 tonnes of food waste per annum from 1.4.2020, up to 37 000 tonnes from 16.1.2021, and up to 45 000 tonnes from 2023 (this will be confirmed in the ITT). A detailed specification for these services is currently under development. The requirements are likely to include the following requirements (full details which may differ to be confirmed in the ITT): • for the AD plant to receive food waste Monday - Saturday, including Public and Bank Holidays in England & Wales (the only exception being Christmas Day, Boxing Day, and New Years Day unless otherwise agreed by KCC); • for the AD plant to receive food waste delivered by articulated vehicles (no tipping trailers; c. net weight 28 tonnes) and bulk haulage vehicles with de-mountable container loading systems (Ro-Ro), tipping discharge mechanism, or non-tipping articulated; • for the AD plant to receive food waste delivered by Refuse Compaction Vehicles (RCVs) and split-bodied RCVs with side pods used to collect food waste from the kerbside where RCVs are able to direct deliver to the AD plant; and • for the AD plant to receive and process food waste collected in both biodegradable and non-biodegradable liners and food waste that may be wrapped in newspaper, kitchen roll or plastic bags; these items should not be considered as 'contamination'. Bidders will be required to pass pass/fail selection criteria regarding their organisation's economic and financial standing, insurance, environmental management, health and safety, and technical and professional ability (including meeting technical minimum requirements), as well as the standard exclusion grounds. Any tenders that do not pass selection criteria will not be evaluated against the award criteria.

tender_title: Bellhouse Closed Landfill Generator - Management and Energy Contract
tender_description:
Essex County Council (the 'Authority') is the operator of the Bellhouse Closed Landfill Site (the 'Site'), which is located in Stanway, Colchester. The Authority is responsible for the management and control of landfill gas emanating from the Site. The Authority has awarded a contract for the management of the landfill gas at the Site and generation of energy from landfill gas from the Site. Details of technical, safety, environmental permit, 
planning permission and other requirements were set out in the services specification available with the tender documents. Additional services may be added to this contract in order to better utilise the resources in relation to the landfill site and/or to maximise any spare capacity which can be exported to the electricity grid network.

tender_title: Procurement of a Joint Venture Partner (JVP) in Relation to Development of a Heat Network
tender_description:
The Council procured a Joint Venture Partner (JVP) with which to enter into a corporate joint venture arrangement (JVA). The purpose of the JVA, which will have an intended duration of 30 years, is to seek commercial benefit to the joint venture partners by delivering heat networks in Cheshire East.
The JVP will, through the JV and the JVA, provide the following services and works:
1) Consultancy and professional services to ensure that the Council can maximum the use of renewable resources particularly geothermal energy in line with the Council's vision for energy to address fuel poverty and increase energy independence.
2) Consultancy and professional services to ensure that the JV realises its full commercial benefit.
3) Works and services related to an initial project based on exploitation of the geothermal resources found in the area.
Works and services provided through the JVA are anticipated to range from 1 000 000 GBP to 100 000 000GBP but no volume or quantity will be guaranteed.
The values given in this notice are estimations only and the Council gives no guarantee or warranty or makes any representation as to the accuracy of any indicative volumes or as to the projects (if any) that will be pursued under the JVA.
classification_description: Electricity, heating, solar and nuclear energy

tender_title: SC19004 - Tonbridge & Malling Household Waste Recycling Centre (HWRC) Services
